Cardiovascular symptom reports

Male, 26 - 39 years

Age Reported Symptoms Notes
26 2021-01-02 body temperature decreased Temperature 100.7 temporal, fevers chills, mild injection site tenderness.
26 2021-01-05 blood pressure increased Immediately after vaccine administration, patient reported he felt faint. Had flushed cheeks and i... Read more
Close
Immediately after vaccine administration, patient reported he felt faint. Had flushed cheeks and increased blood pressure. Had patient recline and was monitored for 20 minutes and felt better.
26 2021-01-10 pallor, fainting Fifteen minutes after receiving vaccine, patient became syncopal upon standing after his observation... Read more
Close
Fifteen minutes after receiving vaccine, patient became syncopal upon standing after his observation period. He fell to the ground, hit his head. Patient was diaphoretic and pale afterwards, and taken to the emergency room for evaluation due to fall.
26 2021-01-17 chest discomfort Symptoms developed 16 hours after injection of the 2nd dose (booster). Symptoms included body aches,... Read more
Close
Symptoms developed 16 hours after injection of the 2nd dose (booster). Symptoms included body aches, nausea, chills, fever, headache, chest tightness. All symptoms resolved within 24 hours with the exception of chest tightness which fully resolved 8 days after the shot.
26 2021-01-17 heart rate decreased, blood pressure decreased After receiving COVID vaccine around 1720 and being observed post vaccination pt returned at 1807 to... Read more
Close
After receiving COVID vaccine around 1720 and being observed post vaccination pt returned at 1807 to observation area with complaints of feeling anxious, pt noted to have flushed face and sweating. BP was 160/88 and HR 108, pt observed for additional time flushing and sweating resolved, pts BP and HR decreased to 137/73 and 73. Pt declined further evaluation in ED
26 2021-01-17 low blood pressure Symptom onset approximately 24 hours after 1st dose given. Experienced sudden onset orthostatic hypo... Read more
Close
Symptom onset approximately 24 hours after 1st dose given. Experienced sudden onset orthostatic hypotension, weakness, and nausea for 36 hours.
26 2021-01-25 fast heart rate Runny nose; tachycardia; Weakness; flu like symptoms; Sore/dry throat; Sore/dry throat; nausea; This... Read more
Close
Runny nose; tachycardia; Weakness; flu like symptoms; Sore/dry throat; Sore/dry throat; nausea; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable nurse (patient). A 26-year-old male patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), intramuscularly on the left arm, first dose on 18Dec2020 (lot number: EH9899) and second dose on 08Jan2021 08:15 (lot number: EL3246), both at a single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included COVID prior vaccination. Concomitant medications were not reported. Patient did not receive other vaccines in four weeks prior to vaccination. The vaccine was given at a hospital. The patient reported sore/dry throat and nausea started Sunday (03Jan2021), weakness and flu-like symptoms on Monday (04Jan2021), then runny nose and tachycardia on Tuesday (05Jan2021). No treatment was received for the events. Patient has not been tested for COVID post-vaccination. Outcome of the events was not recovered.
26 2021-02-01 chest pain 10 minutes after the second dose, patient developed headache, lightheadedness, dizziness, shortness ... Read more
Close
10 minutes after the second dose, patient developed headache, lightheadedness, dizziness, shortness of breath/anaphylaxis. Transferred to ED, and experienced chest pain, SOB, tightness in throat. Patient was sent to the emergency department. Received 25 mg Benadryl prior to arrival as prophylaxis. Received Combivent in the ED, and symptoms improved. Patient was observed for 4 hours in the ED. Eventually patient was discharged home.
26 2021-02-04 fainting Pt had immediate syncopal episode lasting about 30 seconds as witnessed per staff.
26 2021-02-20 palpitations 1/28 - First dose of vaccine received. Arm felt heavy, not sore. Throughout the day, fatigue gradual... Read more
Close
1/28 - First dose of vaccine received. Arm felt heavy, not sore. Throughout the day, fatigue gradually increased. Before bed time, had cold sweats and shakes. 1/29 - woke up feeling perfectly fine. 2/17 - Second dose of vaccine. Arm felt sore and was sore two days after. From 2/18-2/20, I noticed the effects of the Cymbalta were gradually decreasing and was experiencing side effects (shocks from toe to head every step). Turns out that even with taking my regular dose of the Cymbalta, my body after 2 hours feels like I had never taken it. 2/20 - After experiencing heavy shocks, shaking, and heart racing, I went home after coming into work 3 hours later. 2/21 - Woke up today feeling dizzy, fatigued, and weak. I know that operating a motor vehicle will not be possible for me.
26 2021-02-26 loss of consciousness Patient lost consciousness while in the waiting area about 5-10 minutes after vaccination. Gave pat... Read more
Close
Patient lost consciousness while in the waiting area about 5-10 minutes after vaccination. Gave patient water and he laid down for several minutes and then started to feel better
26 2021-03-02 blood pressure decreased Nausea, warmth after vaccine. Initial BP, 89/51. Final BP 111/47; blood glucose 85. Drank water.
26 2021-03-02 heart rate increased chills; slight headache; mild nausea; elevated heart rate; This is a spontaneous report from a non-c... Read more
Close
chills; slight headache; mild nausea; elevated heart rate; This is a spontaneous report from a non-contactable other hcp. A 26-years-old male patient received second dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), intramuscular into Left arm on 15Feb2021 11:15 at SINGLE DOSE for covid-19 immunisation. Medical history included Allergies to medications, food, or other products: shellfish, plant pollen. Historical vaccine included first dose of bnt162b2 on 27Jan2021 11:00 AM Intramuscular into Left arm for covid-19 immunisation. Concomitant medication included estradiol, bicalutamide, progesterone. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. It was reported acute onset of chills and slight headache beginning 13 hours after injection, followed by mild nausea and elevated heart rate lasting 3+ hours, events started on 16Feb2021 12:15 AM. No treatment received for the events. The events were reported as non-serious. Prior to vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19. The outcome of the event was recovering. No follow-up attempts are possible; information about lot/batch number cannot be obtained.
26 2021-03-02 hypotension, fainting Patient stated to RN at observation that " he wants to lay down". RN stated that "she held his head"... Read more
Close
Patient stated to RN at observation that " he wants to lay down". RN stated that "she held his head" as he experienced a syncope event. RN notified Nurse Practitioners . EMS activated. Patients assessed and found to be alert and oriented to place and person. Patient stated that he felt dizzy. Vital signs monitored and patient found to be hypotensive, diaphoretic, and flushed. Epinephrine administered X3 with vital signs monitored in between. Vital signs stabilized and patient transferred to hospital with EMS.
26 2021-03-05 heart rate increased, chest pain 1 week after 2nd dose exactly (3/3/21)- Increased heart rate, hard to breathe, sweating without feve... Read more
Close
1 week after 2nd dose exactly (3/3/21)- Increased heart rate, hard to breathe, sweating without fever, nausea, headache and fatigue. From approximate 9:00 am - 12:00 pm 3/4/21 - Severe chills, fever 102.3, nausea, body aches, insomnia, severe headache frontal lobe and back of head, chest pain when inhaling deeply. 5:00 am - 7:00 pm; got tested for covid and flu this day both came out negative. 3/5/21 - Headache, fatigue, difficulty breathing, nausea, loss of balance.9 am - 1:00 pm. Got plenty of rest the night before should not be tired at all. 3/6/21 - chest pain on left side. 1 am ~ 3 am.
26 2021-03-06 loss of consciousness Loss of consciousness, throwing up, pounding headache, diarrhea, stomach bloating and cramping, and ... Read more
Close
Loss of consciousness, throwing up, pounding headache, diarrhea, stomach bloating and cramping, and body chills within 30 minutes of first dose.
26 2021-03-08 blood pressure increased, chest pain ten mins after shot left arm started going numb. started having chest pain, nausea, didn't feel like... Read more
Close
ten mins after shot left arm started going numb. started having chest pain, nausea, didn't feel like himself bp started going up
26 2021-03-08 chest discomfort Started to experience chills, headache, as well as sensation of chest tightness. The chest tightnes... Read more
Close
Started to experience chills, headache, as well as sensation of chest tightness. The chest tightness feels the same as what I experienced when I had Covid. It is mild, and I do not have a cough. The chest tightness that I had from Covid went away about 3 weeks after my positive test. It had been gone for about 5-6 days when it came back after getting my Pfizer shot.
26 2021-03-08 palpitations, fainting Vision blurring, cold sweat, racing heart rate, flushing and syncope 5 minutes post-injection. EKG s... Read more
Close
Vision blurring, cold sweat, racing heart rate, flushing and syncope 5 minutes post-injection. EKG showed ventricular arrhythmia which converted to normal sinus rhythm with regaining consciousness approximately 5 minutes later.
26 2021-03-09 loss of consciousness Patient was sitting down for a few minutes after their vaccine and then got up to tell the pharmacy ... Read more
Close
Patient was sitting down for a few minutes after their vaccine and then got up to tell the pharmacy staff he wasn't feeling well. He walked back to the waiting room and fell onto the bench. I went out to sit with him and held onto him as he passed out/lost consciousness for approximately 20 seconds. We gave him water and called 911. The paramedics arrived and checked his vitals. He was fine after that and stayed for about a half an hour before he left.
26 2021-03-10 hypotension, oxygen saturation decreased, loss of consciousness About 30 minutes after dose he passed out and had a seizure that lasted 10 -15 seconds. This happene... Read more
Close
About 30 minutes after dose he passed out and had a seizure that lasted 10 -15 seconds. This happened a couple times. He went to hospital had low blood pressure and oxygen. He stabilized and was released. He has a follow up appointment with his primary care doctor.

Close
Systemic: Dizziness / Lightheadness-Mild, Systemic: Fainting / Unresponsive-Mild, Systemic: Hypotension-Mild, Additional Details: Patient fainted, unfortunately did fall, however despite some bruises was ok. Waited for family to come to get him and was able to leave under his own power. Ambulance was called and he was checked, no issues found and did not leave with ambulance.
26 2021-03-11 fainting 5-7? after vaccine, had a fainting episode- fell out of his chair, hit forehead on the floor. Vitals... Read more
Close
5-7? after vaccine, had a fainting episode- fell out of his chair, hit forehead on the floor. Vitals taken immediately after the event and again 10? after event. Vitals stable both times. Patient lay in a cot and drank water to recover. Felt well after 35? and left clinic.
26 2021-03-16 chest pain Throbbing sharp chest pain near heart at wake up, 18 hours after first dose of Pfizer vaccine, durat... Read more
Close
Throbbing sharp chest pain near heart at wake up, 18 hours after first dose of Pfizer vaccine, duration 2 minutes, severity 8/10 Is it possible this was the induction and dispersal of the vaccine by my heart? Has anyone else experienced chest pain 18 hours after their Pfizer vaccine? Thanks!

While in observation for 15 minute post vaccination observation period, recipient complained of dizziness, numbness, light headed, tight chest
26 2021-03-21 loss of consciousness Pt was 15 minutes after his first vaccine when he passed out in his chair and fell to the floor.
26 2021-03-22 fainting Systemic: Chills-Mild, Systemic: Dizziness / Lightheadness-Medium, Systemic: Fainting / Unresponsive... Read more
Close
Systemic: Chills-Mild, Systemic: Dizziness / Lightheadness-Medium, Systemic: Fainting / Unresponsive-Severe, Systemic: ANXIETY, monitored 1 hour post incident -Severe, Systemic: Flushed / Sweating-Severe, Additional Details: Prior to injection patient fainted/syncope, and slowly made his way to the floor with assistance of RN. Pt. was \"out\" for 3-4 sec. aRevived with gentle shaking. Pt was face down taking slow breaths, patient was completely diaphoretic and lost control of his bladder. Paramedics arrived on scene with in minutes and monitored vitals. Pt reported feeling fine but embarassed and still wanted his shot. vaccine given, with paramedics present. pre-syncope rxn., due to anxiety, but fully responsive.
26 2021-03-22 fainting Patient after receiving COVID vaccine and was waiting the required 15 minutes, patient fainted while... Read more
Close
Patient after receiving COVID vaccine and was waiting the required 15 minutes, patient fainted while getting up. First blood pressure was 100/60 while laying down. Patient was conscious, just said he got dizzy and lightheaded. Patient indicated he had not ate in the morning. Second blood pressure was 118/78. Patient does have history of syncope
26 2021-03-22 fainting Vertigo, lightheadedness, and faint
26 2021-03-22 fainting Patient was waiting for the 15mins post vaccine. Three minutes into waiting, patient slumps and fall... Read more
Close
Patient was waiting for the 15mins post vaccine. Three minutes into waiting, patient slumps and falls out chair. He hit his head and turned face down, he then began to start seizing. During this time we held his head, to ensure he did not continue to hit the floor. A team was called, and the team attended to the patient. Patient's vitals were taking and he was stable. To take precaution, he was placed on oxygen to ensure he was comfortable during transfer. When picking the patient off the floor with the staff, patient began seizing once more before being transferred to the ED.
26 2021-03-23 chest discomfort 30 minutes later he developed somewhat of a sore throat that he describes as a throat tightness acco... Read more
Close
30 minutes later he developed somewhat of a sore throat that he describes as a throat tightness accompanied by very slight chest tightness. He denies any angioedema, SOB, DOE, wheezing, rash, itching, or hives.
26 2021-03-23 loss of consciousness ED Note: At 1650, patient was observed following another nurse to the observation area, when he bega... Read more
Close
ED Note: At 1650, patient was observed following another nurse to the observation area, when he began swaying from side to side, lost consciousness and landed on his right side. This nurse approached the patient while other co-workers were assisting him to a chair. The patient was regaining consciousness. The patient's vital signs were as followed: 112/96, pulse ox 99%, pulse 46. This nurse gave the patient water and the patient was alert and oriented X 3. The patient c/o left knee pain but denied any other symptoms. This nurse again checked his vital signs at 1655: 85/52, pulse ox 100%, pulse 86. At this point, rapid response was called and report was given. This nurse moved the patient to a wheelchair to prepare for transport to the E.R. The patient denied any further symptoms at this time except pain in his left knee. This nurse checked his vital signs at 1658: 102/64, pulse ox 100%, pulse 59. Rapid response arrived and this nurse gave report to them. Patient was transported to the E.R. via stretcher. No further issues noted at this time. Pt reports he has a history of getting nervous and "passing out" when getting blood drawn or getting a shot. Pt stated that when he stood up after getting his covid vaccine he felt lightheaded and passed out. ED staff responded to vaccine clinic At 1658 where pt's VS were as follows: 102/64 HR: 59 Sats 100% At present time, pt reports feeling "totally normal" and does not feel that he needs to stay to be seen in ED. Pt comfortable with being monitored by RN for 10 min. Pt still does not want to be seen in ED, wants to leave. Pt ambulated out of ED without difficulty.
26 2021-03-24 pallor Systemic: Allergic: Difficulty Breathing-Mild, Systemic: Nausea-Mild, Systemic: Weakness-Mild, Addit... Read more
Close
Systemic: Allergic: Difficulty Breathing-Mild, Systemic: Nausea-Mild, Systemic: Weakness-Mild, Additional Details: PATIENT STARTED FEELING NAUSEATED AFTER SHOT BECAME PALE ,STUNBLED HAD DIFFICULTY BREATHING AND HE LAID DOWN X 30 MINUTES . AFTER WE CALLED 911 HE SAID HE DIDNT NEED IT BECAUSE HE HAS A REACTION AFTER EVERY IMMUNIZATION

Close
3/24/2021 9:59 AM VACCINE AT 9:30 AM - SYNCOPE- COLD CLAMY, VASOVAGAL RESPONSE CAME TO WITH REPONSE. BP TAKEN NO MEDICAL PROBLEMS.
26 2021-03-26 pallor ON ARRIVAL TO OBSERVATION AREA SEVERAL MINUTES POST VACCINATION, PATIENT OBSERVED AS PALE AND COMPLA... Read more
Close
ON ARRIVAL TO OBSERVATION AREA SEVERAL MINUTES POST VACCINATION, PATIENT OBSERVED AS PALE AND COMPLAINED OF FEELING FAINT. NP HELPED HIM TO THE FLOOR TO SIT. TRANSPORTED TO TRIAGE 1 VIA WHEELCHAIR. DR. ON SITE WITH PARAMEDICS. THIS REPORTING NP ALSO ONSITE WITH NP FROM OBSERVATION AREA. PATIENT'S MOTHER ALSO IN TRIAGE AREA FOR DURATION OF ASSESSMENT AND STABILIZATION. VITAL SIGNS TAKEN AND OBSERVED WIDENED PULSE PRESSURE INITIALLY. PATIENT REMAINED FULL ALERT AFTER 10 MINUTES. hE WAS OFFERED ORAL FLUIDS INCLUDING WATER AND APPLE JUICE. PATIENT WAS RELEASED TO LEAVE FOLLOWING SITTING UP FROM GUERNEY WITH FEET DANGLING THEN GRADUALLY STANDING FOR A MINUTE OR SO BEFORE BEING RELEASED TO LEAVE WITH HIS MOTHER WITH HIM. HE WAS ADVISED REGARDING VASO VAGAL REACTION TO INJECTION AND THAT WE WILL TAKE PRECAUTION WITH SECOND DOSE OF COVID-19 VACCINE.

Close
Systemic: Dizziness / Lightheadness-Mild, Systemic: Shakiness-Mild, Systemic: Weakness-Mild, Additional Details: Pt was pale and stated that he felt as if he was going to pass out, Pt given orange juice and cool paper towel and monitored. Symptoms improved within 10 minutes and pt was able to leave store unaided.
26 2021-03-27 fainting Patient vaccinated and within a few minutes after vaccination, patient with syncope. Able to stabili... Read more
Close
Patient vaccinated and within a few minutes after vaccination, patient with syncope. Able to stabilize patient in chair and bring to first aid. Patient recovered quickly. MD at bedside. Discharged without difficulty.
26 2021-03-28 stroke Had onset of a headache about 2 hours after vaccination on Saturday, 20 March. On Tuesday 23 March, ... Read more
Close
Had onset of a headache about 2 hours after vaccination on Saturday, 20 March. On Tuesday 23 March, at about 11 AM began having a migraine headache (had a past medical history of migraine headaches as a teenager). About 3:10 PM on Tuesday 23 March, began to have tingling and numbness in right hand (he is right-handed). Taken to ER where he could not remember his name. He was admitted and found to have four infarcts in three lobes of his left hemisphere (parietal, frontal and temporal). CT, MRI and cardiographic exams with contrast revealed a patent foramen ovale. Discharged on 40 mg Lipitor and ASA 81 mg, and referred to UCSF Neurology for followup.
26 2021-03-30 fainting In observation area, patient was beginning to slouch in chair. Nurse approached patient and caught h... Read more
Close
In observation area, patient was beginning to slouch in chair. Nurse approached patient and caught him from falling. Had second syncopal episode that lasted approximately 20 seconds, while nurse was holding him. Blood pressure 121/63, blood sugar 112 mg/dl.
26 2021-03-31 nosebleed, fainting Systemic: Fainting / Unresponsive-Mild, Systemic: Seizure-Mild, Systemic: Shakiness-Mild, Additional... Read more
Close
Systemic: Fainting / Unresponsive-Mild, Systemic: Seizure-Mild, Systemic: Shakiness-Mild, Additional Details: patient was administered vaccine, was feeling well and walked to waiting area. patient \"lost balance\" and fell to floor, hitting his face and began bleeding from his nose and upper brow area. Technician retrieved an ice pack from pharmacy, and in the meantime, worker aided patient to sitting position, which was when patient began to seize. worker called EMS while holding patient's head steady. Patient regained consciousness and EMS arrived. Whole event lasted around 5 minutes.
26 2021-03-31 pallor Pt arrives to the observation area after feeling faint following the vaccine administration. he arr... Read more
Close
Pt arrives to the observation area after feeling faint following the vaccine administration. he arrives pale/pasty in color and diaphoretic but alert and oriented. he states he has passed prior when having blood drawn 1700 BP 110/56 HR 56 oxygen sat 100% room air given 120 cc of apple juice tolerated well 1710 BP 115/61 HR 47 oxygen sat 96% room air color is better in the patient 1715 patient given another 120 cc of apple juice 1720 patient states he runs 15 miles a week and that hus resting heart rate is 46 1725 patient sitting on the edge of stretcher feeling better bp 124/62 hr 45 oxygen sat 99% room air 1730 pt discharge home with self and taken to exit via wheelchair

Close
26by/o male, c/o lightheaded ness, dizziness, buzzing in the ears, stated ?I think I passed out?. Pt was pale, cold, clammy, diaphoretic but able to answer questions appropriately. PARAMEDICS came to check pt. V/S HR 51, BP 107/70, O2 sat 98%. NS BOLUS GIVEN, sent to HOSPITAL FOR FURTHER EVALUATION.
26 2021-04-02 fainting Systemic: Dizziness / Lightheadness-Mild, Systemic: Fainting / Unresponsive-Mild
26 2021-04-03 chest discomfort Fatigue, lymph node swelling, night sweats and fever, chest tightness, muscle ache and pains (full b... Read more
Close
Fatigue, lymph node swelling, night sweats and fever, chest tightness, muscle ache and pains (full body). All symptoms persistent and ongoing, beginning after second dose.
26 2021-04-04 fainting Pt. had an episode of fainting in the observation hall 5 mins after receiving the pfizer biontech co... Read more
Close
Pt. had an episode of fainting in the observation hall 5 mins after receiving the pfizer biontech covid-19 vaccine. he regained full consciousness after 15 seconds, was verbal. V/S - bp 131/87, rr 14, hr 64, temp 96.3, pulsox 99% RA. He was assisted to a wheelchair and wheeled to a cubiclePt where he was asked to lay down on a cot for further observation and monitoring Pt was offered water and apple juiced - 625 mls and he finished the fluids. The ambulance team called when the incident occurred arrived but left soon after when the pt. refused to be taken to the hospital At 2:35 pm pt walked out of the premises unassisted. no c/o pain or any injuries resulting from incident noted at the time.

26 2021-04-06 fainting, pallor The patient received vaccine at 1245. At 1246 patient started having an adverse event. The RN notice... Read more
Close
The patient received vaccine at 1245. At 1246 patient started having an adverse event. The RN noticed that the patient started to get white and pale. The RN asked him if he was okay. He stated yes and then he started to faint. The staff gently got him on the floor. They checked his vital signs. His vital signs were within normal limits. They monitored patient for 15 minutes while he was lying on the floor and another 15 minutes in a seated position. They took him to their observation area where they monitored him for another 30 minutes. The patient's mother came in and stated that this happens every time the patient gives blood or receives an injection.
26 2021-04-07 hypotension About 10 minutes after receiving vaccination, patient started experiencing cold sweats and he felt l... Read more
Close
About 10 minutes after receiving vaccination, patient started experiencing cold sweats and he felt like we was about to pass out. I took him into the clinic room and allowed him to lay down and began to fan him down for him to cool off. After 1-2 minutes, we put him on his back and elevated his feet. While he was laying down, I checked his blood pressure and it was low. I let him lay down for 5 more minutes and he started to feel much better and was cooled down. I slowly got him up and allowed him to sit and checked his blood pressure again. The blood pressure began to normalize. After 5 more minutes, I told him to get up and slowly walk to another chair in the room. Once he was rested there for about 5 minutes, I checked his blood pressure a 3rd time in the opposite arm and it was normal. He no longer felt the light headed feeling and was cooled off. The patient's partner then informed me that he has a fear of needles and the last time he received a vaccination about 7 years ago, the same reaction happened.

26 2021-04-18 pallor Patient unresponsive; presented with seizure like activity; Patient fall from chair within 15minutes... Read more
Close
Patient unresponsive; presented with seizure like activity; Patient fall from chair within 15minutes of receiving Pfizer vaccine dose 1; pale; diaphoretic; nausea; Full body clonus; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable nurse. A 26-year-old male patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, solution for injection) (at 26 years of age), dose 1 intramuscular, administered in arm left on 03Apr2021 10:45 (Batch/Lot Number: ER8737) as a single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient's medical history included penicillin allergy. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. The patient had no other vaccine prior to Covid vaccine. He was not diagnosed with COVID-19 prior to vaccination. It was unknown if patient has been tested for COVID-19 since the vaccination. It was reported that the patient fell from chair within 15 minutes of receiving Pfizer vaccine dose 1. Patient was unresponsive, pale, diaphoretic. Awakened within minutes, placed in recovery position on left side. Patient complained of nausea then presented with seizure like activity. Full body clonus. 911 notified. Patient woke within seconds able to state, name, location, date of birth accurately. He was placed on stretcher. EMS arrived. VS 154/80 HR 84, POx99% 2LO2. He continues to be pale. Family of patient notified of event at patient's request. He was transferred to ED via EMS. The events started on 03Apr2021 at 10:45 AM (as reported). Therapeutic measures were taken as a result of the events. The outcome of the events was unknown. Additional information has been requested.; Sender's Comments: Bases on the information in the case report and a strong temporal relationship, A causal relationship between adverse events Unresponsive to stimuli, Seizure and suspect product BNT162B2 cannot be excluded. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to regulatory authorities, Ethics Committees, and Investigators, as appropriate.

This RPH was called to assist patient at 11:27a. Patient stated he felt dizzy and I assisted patient to the floor. Once laying on floor I elevated patient's feet above his head. By stander reported that patient appeared to have blacked out right before I arrived on scene. Patient stayed upright in chair during blackout which only lasted a few seconds. Patient stated he did eat breakfast but had not slept due to working overnight. Patient was assisted to sitting position on floor at 11:33a at which time he drank a bottle of water. After finishing bottle of water he stated he felt dizzy again and I assisted him back to a laying position on floor. After 10 minutes I assisted patient back to a sitting position. After sitting for a few seconds patient stated he felt like he would get sick. Before I could return, patient vomitted on himself and over the floor. Patient continued to vomit/dry heave into trashcan for a few minutes. After patient was done getting sick, he drank another bottle of water. He sat for a few minutes prior to standing. At this time patient's mother-in-law had arrived at store to take patient home. Patient wanted to leave store immediately as he felt it was making him more uncomfortable due to current condition. Patient left store approximately 12p.

26 2021-04-26 palpitations, heart rate increased First noticed symptoms after waking up during the night roughly 14 hours after receiving the 2nd dos... Read more
Close
First noticed symptoms after waking up during the night roughly 14 hours after receiving the 2nd dose of the vaccine. Felt EXTREMELY fatigued and my heart was racing. Fell back asleep and woke up again around 8am. Symptoms persisted. Extremely tired and fatigued and heart was beating fast. Resting heart rate of around 100bpm which jumped to 120bpm when I moved at all (including just rolling over in bed). This persisted throughout the day, and I stayed in bed. In the early afternoon (about 24 hours after 2nd vaccine dose) I started to feel aches in neck and back and started a headache. Took my temperature and had a fever (101). Aches/headache continued to get worse throughout the afternoon. Finally around 4:30pm I found my Tylenol and took a dose. This substantially helped reduce all my symptoms; although I was still tired, it was much less than earlier in the day. Took a dose of Advil around 7:30pm and went to bed about an hour later. By morning, my symptoms were practically all gone, I was just slightly more tired than normal that day (2nd day after vaccine). I did not take any more medication.

26 2021-05-03 loss of consciousness Initial event was hives that didn't itch appearing on elbows, they continued to spread for about a d... Read more
Close
Initial event was hives that didn't itch appearing on elbows, they continued to spread for about a day. The doctor said to start Zyrtec, pepcid and ibuprofen. Hours later vomiting, diarrhea, and a blackout followed along with a fever of 102. This time ER gave IV fluids, acetaminophen, ketorolac, ondansetron, and sodium chloride .9%. At this time no mention or notice was made of the hives previously looked at. After this Zyrtec, Pepcid and acetaminophen were being taken regularly. Throughout the rest of that day the hives got worse along with pretty severe angioedema. Also, a feeling of swollowing around a lump in my throat. No change through the night into next day (Friday) for the hives,swelling and lump feeling in throat. Went to walk in clinic where I was prescribed prednisone tapered for 16 days. After the first day of steroids not much change. After 2 there was some improvement. As of today one week after receiving the 2nd dose of the vaccine approximately 90% of the hives are gone, only mild swelling and some muscle fatigue and pain left.
26 2021-05-04 heart rate decreased Client received the Pfizer Covid-19 Vaccine (Lot #EW0167 Exp. 08/2021) at 10:58 AM. Client was in th... Read more
Close
Client received the Pfizer Covid-19 Vaccine (Lot #EW0167 Exp. 08/2021) at 10:58 AM. Client was in the presence of his sister when he requested to sit outside for fresh air during his 15 minute observation. EMT acknowledged his request and the client sat outside near the entrance while EMT stood near the entrance. Client was with his sister and mother and was checked on every 5 minutes by EMT to see how he was feeling. Client's family seemed unconcerned and the client stated that he had a fear of needles. However, after 10 minutes, client began to complain of feeling like "fainting." Client was a 26 year old male alert and tracking and anxious. Client had a chief complaint of a low heart rate. This was the client's first dose of the Pfizer vaccine and he denied any chronic illness or allergies. Clients blood pressure while sitting up was 88/38 and heart rate was 48 and regular at the radial. Client had no swelling, hives, discoloration, shortness of breath or other signs of anaphylaxis. Client's airway, breathing and circulation were intact and was alert and oriented to person, place, date and event. Client's remaining vitals were respirations 14, eyes 5mm and sluggish, O2 saturation 98%, lung sounds clear bilaterally and temperature 98 degrees f. EMTS brought an observation bed outside to allow the client to lay down and continued to taking vitals at 5 minute intervals. Client's blood pressure improved to 108/72 but heart rate continued to remain low and hovered at the high forties. At 1133 client consented to having EMTs call 911 due to his low heart rate. 911 was called at 1137 and arrived at 1142. Vitals were continuously monitored until firefighters arrived and were as follows: 1123 - 108/76, 52, 14, 02 98%, 1128 - 108/72, 52, 14, O2 97, 1133 - 108/68, 48, 14, O2 98%, 1138 - 108/68, 48, 14, O2 98%, 1138 - 108/72, 48, 14, O2 98%. Paramedics and the fire department assumed care at 11:42. Client was assessed by paramedics and firefighters while on site and it was at this time that client revealed he was under the influence of "edibles." Client consented to EMS transport and departed with Paramedic unit 6 and Fire Engine 7 at 1151. Client transported to Hospital. Registered nurse remained with the patient's mother and daughter to answer their questions and provide emotional support. VAERS completed, confirmation number .

Close
Patient received his first dose tonight. Shortly after he came to the counter complaining of being light headed. He was instructed to sit down and take some deep breaths. Within seconds he tipped his head back and had passed out. EMTs came on site shortly after he came to. He was checked out and given the all-clear.
26 2021-05-05 fainting, loss of consciousness 26 you male patient reported "lightheadedness" about 15-20 seconds after receiving IM injection. He ... Read more
Close
26 you male patient reported "lightheadedness" about 15-20 seconds after receiving IM injection. He then lost consciousness for approximately 30 seconds. Patient was seated in a chair and supported by RN until he regained consciousness. He became diaphoretic upon regaining consciousness, but otherwise reported "feeling better" over the next 1-2 minutes. His vital signs were assessed & wnl. BP 100/55, 99% O2 sat, HR 58, RR 16. Patient stated he's an athletic trainer and had come directly to the vaccine clinic from a workout. He stated he had eaten earlier in the day and believed he was well-hydrated. He was offered additional fluids and walked to another area about 5 minutes after syncope, where he remained in observation for an additional 10 minutes. He then transferred to the general observation area for another 10 or so minutes before feeling well enough to leave. He reported no further symptoms.

Patient states he has a history of this with vaccinations but had not done this with the first dose. Patient returned to baseline within 15 minutes. Patient refused EMS care at site.

He fainted. He felt hot and sweaty afterward. Episode seemed to pass within about 10 minutes all together. Paramedics came and checked him out since he hit his head when he fell. Patient didn't want to go to hospital and was picked up from the store by family member.

Close
passed out/unconscious; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 26-year-old male patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 MRNA VACCINE), dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Right on 30Mar2021 06:00 (Lot Number: ER8732) as SINGLE DOSE and dose 2 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Right on 22Apr2021 06:00 (Lot Number: ER8736) as SINGLE DOSE for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included penicillin, amoxicillin and sulfa drugs allergy from an unknown date and unknown if ongoing. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. Prior to vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, the patient has not been tested for COVID-19. It was reported that after both doses of the vaccine, the patient had a regular evening and a full night's sleep. On 31Mar2021 07:00, the patient stated, "When I woke up and walked to the bathroom, I passed out both times. I was unconscious for a minute and was helped up, but passed out again and woke up a minute later. Emergency medical services were contacted both times". The events resulted in visit in emergency room/department or urgent care. The outcome of the event was recovered on unspecified date. No follow-up attempts are needed. No further information is expected.

Close
within fraction of seconds I fell down (lost conscious); After sometime i woke up I barely could see; On the same night, my left arm (where shot is injected) started paining; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 26-year-old male patient received bnt162b2 (BNT162B2), dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Left on 20Apr2021 17:45, at the age of 26 years old, (Batch/Lot Number: EW0170) as single dose for covid-19 immunisation. The patient medical history was not reported. There were no concomitant medications. The patient previously took Tetanus shot and after 5-10 mins of it he lost conscious for a while. The patient experienced lost conscious on 22Apr2021 07:45 with outcome of recovered, vaccination site pain on 20Apr2021 with outcome of recovered, vision blurred on 22Apr2021 with outcome of recovered. The clinical course was as follows on the same night of vaccination the left arm (where shot is injected) started pain and became pain relief after a day i.e., 21Apr2021. The next day on 22Apr2021 he woke up and went to bathroom for his daily routines. He stepped in shower and stood under water for sometime then he removed the band-aid from the left arm (where the shot is given) within fraction of seconds he fell down (lost conscious) on the left hand side from the bath tub (him legs still in the bath tub) after sometime he woke up and now fell in the bath tub. After sometime he woke up, and he barely could see, tied him towel and came out to him room and laid down for a while. Then everything went back to normal. The patient didn't receive treatment for the events.

Close
Pt reports that he waited for about 20 minutes after being vaccinated. During that time he felt a little hot and drank some water, but says he otherwise felt fine. He states that he stopped for gas after leaving the clinic and has no memories after that until he was being pulled from his car by a paramedic. He states that he was told he had a seizure and crashed his car. After the motor vehicle accident he says he was transported to the hospital, where they told him he had had a seizure, did some tests, and then released him. Pt states his heart rate and glucose were both elevated when he was at the hospital, but that his CT scan was normal. He states he was feeling fine we he got gas, and says he feels fine now (5/10/21: three weeks and two days later). He saw his primary care provider last week (5/5/21) and was referred to Neurology. He had an MRI done, which he reports was normal, and an EEG, which he says he is still waiting on results from. Pt reports no history of seizure prior to 4/17/21.

At 12:58pm while still sitting in his chair, patient was noted to fall out of his chair hitting his right shoulder, right knee and head on the floor. EMT in observation area immediately went to the patient who was laying on the floor. Charge nurse and EMS staff also at patients side. Patient was noted to be pale, and stated he was dizzy. VS stable, Pt stated he usually "passes out" with bloodwork but not with vaccines. EMT's recommended patient be transfered to the hospital due to a potential head injury. Flu like symptoms; Headache; muscle aches; nausea; elevated heart rate; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (Patient himself). A 26-years-old male patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE, formulation: solution for injection), dose 2 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Right on 16Feb2021 11:30 (Batch/Lot Number: EL3247) as 2nd dose, single for covid-19 immunisation. The patient previously received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE), dose 1, administered in Arm right (Batch/Lot number: EL3247) on 26Jan2021 12:30 PM as 1st dose, single for covid-19 immunisation. Medical history included none. There were no concomitant medications. The patient had no known allergies. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within four weeks prior to the vaccination and did not receive other medications in two weeks. Prior to the vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19. On 16Feb2021 23:30 the patient experienced flu like symptoms, headache, muscle aches, nausea, elevated heart rate. No treatment was taken for the event caused. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included heart rate results elevated on 16Feb2021. The outcome of the events were recovering. Follow-up (24Feb2021): This is a follow-up spontaneous report received in response for the first awareness date of the adverse events caused by Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine and the response included with event onset date. (16Feb2021).

administered first dose of Pfizer to patient. Patient was waiting 15 minutes post vaccine and when we went to check on him before closing for lunch, patient reported SOB and difficulty breathing. He stated he was currently a Nurse and requested administration of Epipen. administered 1 dose of EpiPen. Patient requested a second dose of Epipen but did not appear to need another dose and reported tightness lifted off chest but still SOB noted. called 911. administered patient 25 mg Benadryl liquid dose as secondary measure per protocol. 26 2021-05-18 loss of consciousness, fainting, lightheadedness, pallor The patient was unresponsive, pale, and diaphoretic when I arrived at their vehicle. The patient rap... Read more
Close
The patient was unresponsive, pale, and diaphoretic when I arrived at their vehicle. The patient rapidly regained consciousness and was alert. The patient was repositioned with legs elevated. Hydration was given. There was one episode of emesis, which resolved the patient's nausea. This was a vasovagal episode with true syncope. The patient improved rapidly with supportive care, increased monitoring, and hydration. He was returned home with his father as the driver.

This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient's parent). A 26-year-old male patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE) via an unspecified route of administration on an unspecified date (reported as "this afternoon") (Batch/Lot number was not reported) (at 26-year-old) as first dose, single for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient's medical history was reported as no. Concomitant medications were not reported. Couple minutes into that he got light headed, his vision got blurred and then he had a complete vision loss. They cleared the room and called the paramedics. The paramedics came and said that both of his eyes were dilated and his blood pressure was high. They sat him for couple of minutes, then his vision return. So if they ask them make the total of vision loss lasted for seven minutes. His blood pressure went down. They kept him there and had a given a bottle of water and two container of fruit juice to bring his sugar level up. They made sure everything seems alright. And paramedics left and said that they thought it would be cause from some sort of blood reaction and allergic reaction to vaccine. And told them not to get the second shot. And let us want to he felt ok that it would be alright to go home. They did keep him there for about half an hour longer just to make sure he was alright and then sent him home. That was just a reaction and he should be ok now. No treatment received. The outcome of the events was resolved on an unspecified date. Information about batch/lot number has been requested.

Close
He received his second dose of Pfizer vaccine 12 May 2021 and had expected symptoms of fever, chills, and sweats. He woke up at 0530 the following morning to take Tylenol and lost consciousness while getting out of the bed. He was taken to the ER for eval, had labs performed and EKG completed, reports normal. Also given fluid boluses and observed for a few hours then discharged. He has not had any reoccurring episodes and has returned back to his baseline.

26 2021-05-25 inflammation of the heart muscle, chest pain A 26-year-old male with no past medical history presents to the emergency department (ED) with an ac... Read more
Close
A 26-year-old male with no past medical history presents to the emergency department (ED) with an acute episode of chest pain. He reports initially mild dull substernal chest pain for a day prior to an episode of acute sharp chest pain that radiates to his left neck and left shoulder accompanied by diaphoresis leading him to present to the ED. He had received the second dose of the Pfizer-BioNTech mRNA COVID-19 vaccine three days prior to presentation and reported myalgia and weakness beginning within 24 hours of vaccination. His blood pressure on arrival was 126/83 mmHg and pulse was 61 bpm. Electrocardiogram (ECG) on admission showed diffuse upsloping 2mm STE, no reciprocal changes, and PR elevation in aVR. Troponin-I on admission was 6.03 ng/ml prior to peaking at 21 ng/ml while initial CRP was 56.8 mg/L. Transthoracic echo (TTE) showed left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) of 55-60% with hypokinesis of the basal lateral wall. Cardiac magnetic resonance imaging (CMR) was consistent with myocarditis showing subepicardial late gadolinium enhancement (LGE) in the basal inferior wall, no edema on T2 sequences, and a mildly reduced left ventricular systolic function with an LVEF of 51%. He was started on colchicine, low dose beta blocker and losartan and improved symptomatically along with resolution of the EKG findings prior to being discharged with plan for close outpatient follow-up and repeat imaging. In addition, a respiratory viral PCR panel was obtained which was positive for Rhinovirus/Enterovirus on nasal swab. Although it is possible that his presentation was secondary to enteroviral myocarditis, the temporal relationship to the second dose of Pfizer-BioNTech mRNA COVID-19 vaccine suggests the possibility of myocarditis secondary to immunologic response to COVID-19 vaccine itself.

Pt very diaphoretic with decrease in skin color. Didn't hit head. Pt mother called per pt request and states him having no hx of seizures and NKA. BP 94/60 and HR 84. 9:20 am pt assisted to stretcher with heavy assist. 9:24am A&O when EMS unit arrived to transport pt to hospital for further evaluation and care.

They have been random and infrequent enough I have not done anything about it (also, I am currently uninsured), but v-safe suggested I should submit a VAERS report of it anyway. Obviously I cannot be entirely sure it is related, but it is not something I have experienced before.

Soon developed fever, chills, and night sweats, and eventually tachycardia (resting 160 bpm) with atrial flutter and then atrial fibrillation Original pain was within the week of the vaccine, but the fever came on about a month later and lasted for 2 weeks.

26 2021-06-01 palpitations heart was racing; throat getting a little tight; This is a spontaneous report received from a contac... Read more
Close
heart was racing; throat getting a little tight; This is a spontaneous report received from a contactable pharmacist via a Pfizer- sponsored program and Medical Information Team. A 26-year-old male patient received first dose of BNT162b2 (COMIRNATY, solution for injection, lot number: EW0153), via an unspecified route of administration on 26Apr2021 as 1st dose, single for COVID-19 immunization. The patient medical history and concomitant medications were reported as none. It was reported that, the patient got the first shot on 26Apr2021, instantly he's heart was racing and 5 minutes after he felt his throat getting a little tight, after 5 minutes still tight, 2-3 minutes it resolved on its own without any medication, no Benadryl and no medical assistance, he was okay after that. Patient confirmed that he did not experienced difficulty of breathing. The patient was advised to go to the doctor's office or hospital for the second shot in case he gets an anaphylaxis or worse reactions to the second dose. He states that the symptoms were resolved in about 2 minutes on the same day. The pharmacist was asking if these were considered as a severe allergic reaction and he wants to know if the patient should get the second dose or not. The outcome of the events heart was racing and throat getting a little tight was recovered on 26Apr2021.
26 2021-06-07 pallor, loss of consciousness Patient received Pfizer Covid Vaccine (lot #EW0187 exp. 8/31/21) first dose and while walking to the... Read more
Close
Patient received Pfizer Covid Vaccine (lot #EW0187 exp. 8/31/21) first dose and while walking to the monitoring area he lost consciousness briefly and fell over chair that he was turning to sit in. After being laid flat, he immediately regained consciousness and was awake, alert, oriented x 3. VS BP 110/60, P-70 and pulse ox 100%, R-20. Color pale. He was moved to a geri-chair with his feet up. He refused to go to ER and stayed x 30 minutes to be monitored with no further incidents. VS at end of monitoring period 108/68, P-66, pulse ox 100%, R 20. Color became pinker, was able to tolerate drinking 240 oz. of water and eating a slice of cake. Offered to be transported to ED again but patient refused. Patient was instructed to follow up with ER or Primary Care Provider with any further symptoms.
26 2021-06-07 fainting, palpitations, chest pain heart palpitations; fainted while using the restroom and woke on the bathroom floor; more like a sor... Read more
Close
heart palpitations; fainted while using the restroom and woke on the bathroom floor; more like a sore or a strain; more like a sore or a strain; felt more strange; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 26-year-old male patient received second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), via an unspecified route of administration on 11May2021 at 11:00 (Lot Number: EW0176, expiration date: Aug2021, at the age of 26-year-old) as 0.3 ml, single dose for covid-19 immunisation. The patient medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. The patient previously took first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), via an unspecified route of administration on 19Apr2021 about 5:00pm (lot number: ER8731, expiration date: Jul2021, at the age of 26-year-old) as single dose for covid-19 immunisation. When he got the first one, he was fine. The day after he received the second shot, he fainted while using the restroom and woke on the bathroom floor on 12May2021 at 07:30, he was on the floor for a few minutes, 2 to 3 minutes. After that there was no other fainting. Patient had been having heart palpitations since the second dose on 13May2021. Did not particularly remember the time, just that it was in the middle of the day. The palpitations were going away and were less prevalent. He went to the Emergency room (ER) this past Sunday night because it was really working up and he couldn't wait to go to the doctor. Physician office was no. Electrocardiogram (EKG) and blood work were done in the emergency room on unspecified date in May2021 and came back normal. He was supposed to meet with a cardiologist next week. On unspecified date in May2021, he still felt kind of like he senses his heart beating but he didn't usually think about. It felt more strange, than soreness. This was all just so new. Thought it was a sign that he was going to recover and it was going to go away. The palpitations were coming on less and less. Was not so much of an irregular heart beat than last week. On unspecified date in May2021, felt like his heart was getting strong. Felt like his heart was making it's way back and was more like a sore or a strain. It had been going down and he was not feeling his heart in his chest. Treatment was no, not this far. There was not prior vaccinations within 4 weeks. The outcome of the event "fainted while using the restroom and woke on the bathroom floor" was unknown, for other events was recovering.

Close
patient reports having tingling/chills about 90 min after vaccination. No rash/hives/swelling or difficulty breathing. Some lightheadedness and feeling of blacking out. Patient did not have this reaction with the first pfizer shot. Patient was concerned since the onset was so soon after vaccination. Recommended patient rest as much as possible, drink plenty of water and eat some food. Patient may take tylenol if needed for fever/pain. Patient did have a granola bar and water for breakfast and had just recently ate lunch. Recommended no driving or any activity that requires attention/moving due to lightheadedness. Patient does have someone that will be checking in on him to see how he is doing. Advised that patient seek medical attention if condition worsens or if any trouble breathing or swelling

extreme headache resulting in fainting and twitching while unconscious; extreme headache resulting in fainting and twitching while unconscious; extreme headache resulting in fainting and twitching while unconscious; extreme headache resulting in fainting and twitching while unconscious; This is a spontaneous report from a non-contactable consumer (patient). A 26-year-old male patient received BNT162B2 (Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine, lot number and expiry date unknown), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in the left arm on 25May2021 at 11:00 as an unknown dose number, at a single dose for COVID-19 immunization. The patient's medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. Prior to vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. Since the vaccination, the patient has not been tested for COVID-19. The patient experienced extreme headache resulting in fainting and twitching while unconscious on 25May2021 at 20:00. The outcome of the events was recovering. 26 2021-06-12 increased heart rate, heart rate increased, chest discomfort, ejection fraction decreased I began to experience rapid heart rates to the 140s intermittently starting on the Wednesday followi... Read more
Close
I began to experience rapid heart rates to the 140s intermittently starting on the Wednesday following my first vaccination. I also had associated neck pain and "pounding sensation" in my neck, chest, and arms. I had difficulty lying flat at night and developed a dry cough. I went to the urgent care on 4/19/21 and was diagnosed with torticollis. No one at the urgent care listened to my heart or lungs. Given that my symptoms had been diagnosed, I delayed seeking further treatment. My symptoms continued to worsen. I had difficulty walking long distances, exercising. I became short of breath easily. I ended up going to my primary care doctor on 4/26/21 for a second evaluation. He was concerned and did an EKG, it only showed sinus tachycardia. He scheduled me for an echocardiogram and put me on a beta blocker (Bystolic) 5 mg once daily. The echo showed EF 47% with global hypokinesis of the L ventricle. Doctor called me into the office as soon as he saw the results, concerned for myocarditis or pericarditis.

Close
I haven?t gone to a doctor. Before any news came out about heart inflammation, I felt my heart beating really fast after this vaccine. Now it?s been 2 months and I still feel like my heart is ?inflamed?. I?m a big believer in science, and I stand by the vaccine, but literally my heart has been hurting a lot more (IT LITERALLY NEVER HURT) before the vaccine. I really hope I didn?t just mess up my body somehow with this. Legitimately the pain is not bad at all (maybe a 2 out of ten) but it has not gone down since I got the vaccine. I notice when I do physical activity I also get tired faster. I run, I?m a relatively healthy person but I?m experiencing some mild heart inflammation after this shot. Please take note. I still stand beside the vaccine, I?m just explaining what symptoms I?m feeling. And of course idk if it?s from the vaccine, but I?ve never had this feeling in my heart before having this vaccine. I hope it goes away.

The patient did not receive any treatment for the events. The clinical outcome of the events sore / achy, feverish, chills, red and tender swollen injection site, lightheaded, swollen and tender armpit glands, elevated heart rate were resolving at the time of this report. No follow-up attempts are needed. No further information is expected. 27 2021-01-03 fast heart rate, palpitations Tachycardia; Intermittent palpitations; Low grade fever/fever; muscle aches; This is a spontaneous r... Read more
Close
Tachycardia; Intermittent palpitations; Low grade fever/fever; muscle aches; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable physician. A 27-year-old male patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), intramuscularly in unknown arm on 17Dec2020 at single dose for routine mass immunizations (covid-19 immunization). The COVID-19 vaccine was administered at Hospital. Not a military facility. The patient's medical history was reported as none and concomitant medications was none (he was on no other medications). The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. The patient experienced tachycardia, intermittent palpitations, low grade fever/fever all started somewhere in the morning of 18Dec2020 and muscle aches on 17Dec2020. Physician assessed tachycardia and intermittent palpitations as serious due to medically significant. Physician stated that one of his workers had the vaccine and proceeded to have tachycardia and low grade fever. He would like to know if patient should get the second dose. The patient had mostly tachycardia with some intermittent palpitations. Patient was seen in his office on 18Dec2020, and got the COVID vaccine on 17Dec2020. He also reported fever and muscle aches, although the fever was subjective and was not documented. Tachycardia improved and sent him to cardiology on 21Dec2020. It was not life threatening and they did an Electrocardiogram (EKG). His initial heart rate was 130. When he was seen again in their office on 21Dec2020, it was 93, which was baseline. It improved. He never got his temperature. The highest in office was 99.5 degrees Fahrenheit. He had some muscle aches. The physician just sent patient to cardiology because he was having intermittent tachycardia and intermittent palpitations. Two visits to physician office. He was seen on 18Dec2020 and again on 21Dec2020. Relevant tests: they did testing for tachycardia but not related specifically. They did thyroid and EKG in office and he did not know if test were back. EKG was ok. The Thyroid, Complete blood count (CBC) and lipid (all were on an unknown date in Dec2020) were not back and were just done to make sure there were no cardiac issues. The outcome of the events was recovering. The lot/batch number has been requested.; Sender's Comments: Based on temporal association, the causal relationship between BNT162B2 and the events tachycardia and palpitations cannot be excluded. This case will be reassessed once additional information becomes available. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees, and Investigators, as appropriate.

Around 7 pm I started feeling really anxious. I checked my HR on my smart watch and it said that around 12pm my HR was 157bpm which was right after getting the vaccine when I started walking home. My resting HR is usually 47-52bpm. I am a very active person. I have been waking up in the middle of the night multiple times in night sweats and it feels like my heart is contracting very hard. I notice that my HR jumps up right when I start to be more active, but more than normal. On the 11th my average walking HR was 140. Today at work my HR was 134 at the highest around 9am and the lowest was 56bpm around 7am when I was getting ready for work. Additionally to the increased HR I have SOB when I walk and talk. I did have a sore arm as well the first day, but nothing more than any other injection I have had before.

Close
Occipital neuralgia; anaphylaxis; feeling like passing out on and off for the next 2-3 hours; he felt lightheaded; little short of breath; fatigue; he had a lot of posterior lymph pain in the back of his head, for 2 weeks on and off; heaviness at the back of his head left sid; chest tightness; he developed a sensation like he was going to lose control of his mind; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable Other Health Professional, the patient. A 27-year-old male patient received the second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 MRNA VACCINE, Lot number EL1283), via an unspecified route of administration on 08Jan2021 at 13:30 (at the age of 27-years-old) as a single dose in the left arm for COVID-19 vaccination. Medical history included asthma exacerbation, GERD, childhood anemia, a retinal tear in the right eye all from unspecified dates and unknown if ongoing. The patient also reported medical history three episodes (June 2019, August 2019 and October2019) of anaphylaxis due to "Exercise Induced Anaphylaxis." Historical vaccinations included the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 MRNA VACCINE, lot number EH9899) on 21Dec2020 at 13:30 after which he experienced pain at the vaccination site which lasted twenty-four hours. The patient's past product use included adrenaline (EPIPEN), an unspecified corticosteroid and an unspecified antihistamine for past allergic reactions. The vaccine was administered in a hospital. Prior to the vaccination, the patient had not been diagnosed with COVID-19. Concomitant medications included ciclosportin (RESTASIS), azelastine (AZELASTINE), mometasone furoate (FLONASE), cetirizine hydrochloride (ZYRTEC) and omeprazole (PROTONIX) all for unknown indications from unknown dates and unknown if ongoing. Within four weeks prior to the vaccination the patient had received unspecified "allergy shots" He received "two shots" (one in each deltoid) on 15Dec2021 and "two shots" (one in each deltoid) on 05Jan2021. The patient reported that fifteen to thirty seconds after the second dose of the COVID-19 vaccination he felt lightheaded and a little short of breath. This lasted about eight minutes and then subsided. Approximately thirty to forty minutes (about 30 minutes after he left the facility) later the symptoms returned. He felt short of breath and he thought he was going to pass out. The symptoms included fatigue, shortness of breath lightheaded and feeling like passing out on and off for the next two to three hours. He stated he has completely recovered. He continued to say that he was feeling fine for three days then he began having bilateral cervical lymph pain greater on the left than right, a lot of posterior lymph pain in the back of his head (for two weeks on and off). These symptoms also resolved on their own. He also experienced ("a couple of days later") a sensation where he thought he was going to lose control of his muscles and lose consciousness. He also developed a sense that the was going to lose control of his mind with heaviness at the back of his head, left side. He went to the Emergency Room (date not provided) and they provided Valium. He also reports an Emergency Room visit on 13Jan2021 during which he underwent a CT scan of the head which was normal and a neuro consult suggesting occipital neuralgia and he was put on muscle relaxers. He also stated that experienced shortness of breath and chest tightness after his allergy shots on 26Jan2021 and he specified that he had never before had these reactions to his allergy shots. After that he had yet another possible allergic reaction after eating pizza on 30Jan which included throat swelling as well. He further stated that on 04Feb he had anaphylaxis vs asthma exacerbation. On the following day he developed a heaviness to his left occipital head with that same feeling of wanting to lose control of his muscles. He never had that before. He started Prilosec about one and one half weeks prior to the reporting date. In follow up the Other HCP reporter/patient answered "Yes" to the following questions (DCA) about symptoms experienced: Bilateral wheeze/bronchospasm, upper airway swelling, increased use of accessory respiratory muscles, dry cough, difficulty breathing (without wheeze or stridor, sensation of throat closure, tachycardia, nausea. These were reported without dates and without context with regard to the events reported initially. These were also reported as not requiring treatment and having recovered on unspecified dates. Lab data included three SARS COV 2 nasal swab tests (14Jan2021, 03Feb2021 and 11Feb2021) all of which were negative. Unspecified treatment was reported for the events anaphylactic reaction and mental impairment. The clinical outcomes of the events Anaphylaxis, loss of consciousness, dizziness, dyspnea, fatigue and lymph node pain were reported as recovered on an unspecified date in 2021. The clinical outcome of mental impairment, heaviness of head, chest tightness and occipital neuralgia were reported as unknown.

27 2021-03-04 chest pain, inflammation of the heart muscle, chest discomfort Patient is a 27 year old male with no significant medical history presents to MC on 2/6 from Urgent ... Read more
Close
Patient is a 27 year old male with no significant medical history presents to MC on 2/6 from Urgent Care for further evaluation of chest pain. He states that he woke up at 5:30am with abrupt onset of chest pain with present like quality in the middle of the chest. It was non-radiating with associated nausea, small amount of emesis, and dyspnea. His pain lasted for about 15 minutes and he started experiencing it again after half an hour with numbness and tingling of his bilateral distal digits and diaphoresis. He decided to seek evaluation at local Urgent Care around 7:30am. States that he was immediately send here through ambulance due to findings of EKG changes. He was given aspirin and nitroglycerin with some alleviation of pain. Currently, he feels little better although continues to have chest pressure substernally every 45 minutes lasting 5-10 minutes. His dyspnea is resolved. He does not have pleuritic chest pain, fever, chills, nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, diarrhea, leg swelling, rash. Additionally, he has been in normal state of health until this 2/2/21 when he received second dose of COVID-19 (Pfizer) vaccine. He had extreme fatigue with left arm soreness. He reports no sick contacts, recent illness, or travel. MRI cardiac done 2/9/21 with assessment reveals Infero-lateral myocarditis. Patient remained hemodynamically stable and was discharged with ibuprofen taper for 10 days, c/w colchicine 0.6 mg QD x 3 months and pantoprazole 40 mg QD

Treatment at clinic: Oxygen mask was put on to 4 litters, breathing treatment done, Benadryl, Pepcid, Tylenol, and then eppy shot was given. Ambulance then came to clinic and took my son to the ER. Most of the same thing was done in the ER. Patient still felt bad after 4 or 5 hrs in ER room. So he was admitted to stay in the hospital. He stayed 3 days and 2 nights in the hospital. 27 2021-03-22 lightheadedness Vasovagal response. Patient arouse from his chair in waiting area after vaccination and while consci... Read more
Close
Vasovagal response. Patient arouse from his chair in waiting area after vaccination and while conscious, fell to the ground. Patient was assisted with ambulatory back to exam room and laid on the exam table. Feet were raised above the level of heart and he stated that he felt much better within 5 minutes of this maneuver. Over a 45 minute period, patient positioning was slowly elevated from laying to sitting, then to standing, and was escorted in a walk around the store. Patient performed all of these tasks without incident. Called patient the next morning to check on status. Patient reported that he did just fine getting home and had no other incidents since vasovagal response.

Close
28 yo M reported feeling unwell (lightheaded, hot, need to sit down) within 5 minutes of receiving first dose of Pfizer COVID vaccine. Subsequently had a syncopal event, while sitting reclined between bleacher seats. His head was supported. Patient was laid down with feet elevated and he regained consciousness within 15 seconds. Vitals: 132/79, O2 98%, P 79, RR 16. No facial edema, rash. Patient was given water and a snack, was observed for 30 minutes, after which he reported feeling much better.

27 2021-03-30 pallor Client reported before vaccination a history of syncopal episodes s/p vaccine administration due to ... Read more
Close
Client reported before vaccination a history of syncopal episodes s/p vaccine administration due to a needle phobia. Client received vaccine and had a syncopal episode while in the chair. Client slumped into a person sitting next to him. Client roused after approximately 1 minute of unconsciousness, and was initially difficult to arouse. Client was moved to a cot via wheelchair and placed in reverse trendelenberg position. Initial vitals 75/43 pulse 40, sinus bradycardia rhythm, skin was pale and diaphoretic. Client had a follow up blood pressure 5 minutes after the syncopal episode of 76/44, pulse 50. Client was offered transport versus watchful waiting by EMS staff, and opted for watchful waiting. Client had gradual return to full mentation, and skin turned to pink, warm and dry. Follow up vitals 116/82, pulse 68, spO2 100% on RA. Client continued to improve and remained in observation area for 30 minutes, and was given a ride home by his wife. Client refused transport by EMS and evaluation in the emergency department.

Patient could not speak and was showing signs of passing out. RPH was able to keep pt conscious and within 5 minutes pt could say his name and count backwards from 10.

Close
Patient had received Covid vaccination and was seated in monitoring area. Patient was being monitored by nurse. She states patient complained of feeling lightheaded. Took off coat and drank some water. She checked his pulse at that time, and reports 60. She reported to other staff in area. Patient explained that he has done this in the past with injections, but not always. He was sipping water, diaphoretic. At 0918 patient became was extremely diaphoretic, lips blue, eyes rolled back, and patient was unconscious, No pulse detected. I lowered him to floor from chair. EMT checked again for carotid pulse and I placed hands in position to start compressions. Faint pulse noted, and did not begin compressions. Nurse practitioner came over assisted by raising lower extremities onto chair. 0919 patient oxygen sats 91-93 percent. Ambulance en route. Patient color improving, responding appropriately, alert and oriented. heart rate 51. blood pressure 112/59. 0921. EMS on site, patient still pale, and slightly diaphoretic, much improved though, b/p 119/62. hr 61 pulse ox 91 percent. EMS assumed care.

Event resulted in Doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit. The outcome of the event was recovered. Information about lot/batch number has been requested

27 2021-04-14 chest discomfort 4/10/2021 experienced some right side facial paralysis upon waking. Called urgent care who directed... Read more
Close
4/10/2021 experienced some right side facial paralysis upon waking. Called urgent care who directed me to go to a hospital as soon as possible and asked about all events leading up to this, noting that the vaccine may potentially have this side effect, as written in the medical journal. Went to the ER, they put me in stroke protocol, did CAT scan, negative results, blood tests (including for Lyme), MRI to look for tumors after the CAT scan was negative, and an echocardiogram as they detected a new heart murmur never present before. MRI showed Bell's palsey in one facial nerve, all other tests are negative, including for Lyme's disease, a common cause. I am still experiencing it, and am on Valtrex (anti viral) and Prednisone, but the symptoms still exist. There is no other change in my life or health, the only thing I've done differently is have the vaccine (for which we are grateful).

Close
I had intense stomach pains, muscle pains for 4 days. Could not get out of bed. Also had a fever. I thought these were regular side effects and eventually got better. Then, about a week later I started getting nose bleeds with blood clots coming out of my nose. These lasted a few more days. This never happened to me before, and must have been a side effect from the vaccine.

Close
On day 3 following, 2nd dose of Pfizer vaccine, he had right sided calf pain. Initially thought to be recurence of strain injury, although no history of trauma or obvious trigger. Pain conitnued to worsen and had different characteristics than original strain symptoms. Continued to worsen to point wher eunable to weight bear and swollen, hot and red. Saw orthopedist who refered to vascular surgeon, and on day 13 was officially diagnosed with large DVT extending form tibeal & peroneal, popliteal up to the femoral veins. Has no known clotting defects. Currently under evaluation with hematologist who recommended anticoagulants for remainder of his life.

Close
Client began to complain of feeling dizzy and experiencing tunnel vision right after receiving the vaccine. Ice pack was applied to back of client's neck. About 5min after receiving the shot the client stated he thought he was going to pass out. 2 RN's walked client to a safe place to lie down. Client began to pass out while walking and was carefully lowered to the floor. Total time unconscious was about 30 seconds. Client began talking though mumbled. About 3 min later client stated he was feeling better. Another 3 min and client moved from laying on the ground to sitting in a chair. He stated he was less dizzy but his arms felt tingly. Client eating crackers and drinking water. Vitals remained stable throughout incident. Client was released to personal vehicle at 1:41pm, walked out of building on his own, gait was steady. Educated pt to request to lie down for 2nd vaccine.

Patient experienced syncope resulting in a laceration to the chin in the 15 minutes following vaccination. Patient was tended to by the NP on duty, instructed to lie down and drink water while she tended to his cut. Patient mentioned it "tasted like he threw up" and still felt lightheaded after 15 minutes after the event. Patient was insistent that we should not call the squad as he does not have insurance. Patient in the meantime was trying to get ahold of a friend or family member to pick him up as we advised him that he could not leave in this state. We elected to call the squad as he had not recovered yet. Before the squad could come, the patients brother showed up and quickly whisked him away. Squad did show up but there was nothing to attend to so left without intervention.

Before the squad could show up patients brother came to pick him up... was whisked away too quickly for us to stop him. Patient was adamant about us not calling squad because he does not have insurance.

27 2021-04-26 loss of consciousness, cardiac arrest, haemoglobin decreased, platelet count decreased Patient with known alcoholism, found down and out covered in blood for an unknown period of time. B... Read more
Close
Patient with known alcoholism, found down and out covered in blood for an unknown period of time. Brought to Healthcare Facility by ambulance for treatment, and planned to transfer. Suspected GI bleed; when flight crew arrived, decided to intubate. Failed first attempt, and patient when into cardiac arrest. Was revived with CPR and 2 doses of epinephrine. Pt also received TXA and 1 unit PRBC, and fluids. Successful second attempt, though BPs remained labile. Pt transferred to ICU and was notified that additional evaluation found bleed had actually occurred proximal GI tract (oral mucosal bleed, not esophageal). Pt also diagnosed prior to transfer with multilobar pneumonitis, ascites secondary to alcohol cirrhosis, hematemesis/meme positive stool, leukocytosis and pancreatitis. Was notified by ICU less than 24 hours later that pt was on vent and stable.

Onset: 4/28/2021 Sx: fever, chills, cough, SOB, fatigue, myalgias, h/a, loss of taste & smell, sore through, runny nose & congestion. Brief LOC today with brief mild disorientation and confusion immediately after. Social: no reported exposures Immz: Pfizer #1 = 1/19/2021 & Pfizer #2 = 2/10/2021
27 2021-04-30 fluid around the heart, cardiac arrest, heart failure 27 year old male with Down's Syndrome and no other past medical history received second COVID-19 vac... Read more
Close
27 year old male with Down's Syndrome and no other past medical history received second COVID-19 vaccine on 4/27/2021. On 4/30/2021 began "feeling poorly" with nausea/vomiting and possible chest discomfort. Originally presented to ED on morning of 4/30 - EKG completed demonstrated diffused ST elevation. Patient was transferred to Medical Center for heart catheterization. Left heart catheterization demonstrated normal coronary arteries and LVEDP of 25. Stat ECHO demonstrated pericardial effusion and concern raised for myopericarditis. Patient subsequently transferred to a different Medical Center for higher level of care. Upon arrival to Medical Center plan was to intubate and take to cath lab for heart biopsy and PA catheter placement. However, upon intubation patient began to decompensate and subsequently developed cardiac arrest. During ACLS, VA ECMO was placed and therapeutic hypothermia was initiated. Following VA ECMO placement patient received IVIG, high dose methylprednisolone (1000 mg), anakinra 100 mg, and broad spectrum antibiotics (vancomycin and Zosyn). Despite these efforts the patient continued to have hemodynamic instability and was on high dose vasopressors (epinephrine, norepinephrine, dopamine, angiotensin II, vasopressin). Patient subsequently suffered another cardiac arrest, briefly regained pulse with high dose vasopressors, but subsequently lost pulse despite best efforts and died on 5/1/2021 at approximately 13:00.

Systemic: Fainting/Unresponsive-Severe. Additional Details: Patient had a syncope episode post vaccine administration. Unresponsive for about 5 minutes. Paramedics were called, patient had recovered from his episode quickly.
