He was feeling restless, clammy, and dizzy and appeared pale during his 15-minute waiting period after vaccine administration. I had him lie down on the floor with his feet up for about 10 minutes until he felt confident to sit in the chair for another 10 minutes or so. As he was lying on the floor, We brought him a bottle of water. His color came back shortly after lying down on the floor. He stated that he has previously had panic attacks after shots, blood draws, etc. He stated he was no longer dizzy when he stood up to leave.
33 2021-04-08 pulmonary embolism Morning of April 4, pt experienced a full aching in his right side (front, below shoulder, above rib... Read more
Close
Morning of April 4, pt experienced a full aching in his right side (front, below shoulder, above ribs). This went away after a few hours. Around 1 am EDT on April 7, the pain returned, slowly subsiding over the course of 12 hours. Between 6-7 pm EDT on April 7, a new more intense pain started in his mid-back, right side accompanied by shortness of breathe. We took him to the ER where he was diagnosed with three pulmonary emboli. He was given blood thinner tablets and send home with prescriptions for more thinners and pain medications. 1.5 days later, his pain has not subsided. He is also protein s deficient and has fact v leiden (homozygous).
33 2021-04-08 pulse abnormal, very slow heart rate, pallor, loss of consciousness Patient presented for his first vaccine dose. He later stated he felt a sensation of something movin... Read more
Close
Patient presented for his first vaccine dose. He later stated he felt a sensation of something moving through his arm after vaccine administered, then states he felt some increased anxiety, followed by cold sweats, and then lost consciousness. He was noted to be unresponsive, initially with brief period of apnea, and was unresponsive to sternal rub by vaccine administration staff. He was placed into a reclined position in the driver seat of his vehicle. He regained consciousness within a minute, and was normally responsive but with pale color noted to face and chest, diaphoresis, and thready pulse with bradycardia, HR 43. Difficult to auscultate HR and breath sounds clear but shallow. EMS responded promptly and assisted with evaluation, with initial BP 80/50, SpO2 97%. Patient became less responsive and started to lose consciousness again, but responded to questioning, then lost consciousness again. His feet were placed on the dashboard to elevate them, and he quickly regained consciousness, pulse improved to HR 86, and repeat BP after a few minutes was 140/76. Oxygen saturations briefly dipped to 90% then rebounded to 100%. He improved quickly, was normally responsive and able to drink orange juice. He had pale clammy skin on the face, neck and hands, and some facial flushing. Patient was monitored for several minutes, had improvement in symptoms, and refused transport by stretcher to the ambulance. He was able to walk to the passenger side of his vehicle and was driven out of the vaccination facility and further monitored. Blood glucose noted to be 96, EKG normal with sinus rhythm, no acute ST or T wave changes or other acute abnormality. Patient was offered transport to the hospital for further evaluation, but he declined. Symptoms resolved completely, he was monitored for resolution of symptoms. He reported prior similar symptoms after a hand laceration at work and after a dental visit. Risks discussed, prevention measures for second dose discussed. Encouraged follow up with PCP given recurrent vasovagal syncope. No signs of allergy noted.

Close
Systemic: Dizziness / Lightheadness-Medium, Systemic: Headache-Mild, Additional Details: after taking the vaccine, patient was walking towards the waiting area to wait for 15 minutes but fell down on the floor and hit his nose and it started bleeding. i evaluated the patient and gave him water and washed him up. patient told me he was feeling a lot better. he was having a headache from the impact of his head hitting the floor when he fell but he feels better otherwise. i kept the patient here for an extra hour to make sure the patient is ok otherwise and gave him water.

Close
Began to develop a slight brain fog one hour upon dose administration. Otherwise mild. Went to bed at 11:00 pm and woke up at 2 am with heart thumping with pulse beating around 70 beats per minute. Became highly attuned to it and experienced tacychardia at 118 (generally resting heart rate is extremely low). Seemed to return to 70 with some breathing exercises and returned to sleep. Woke up the next morning with flu symptoms and the works - felt worse than original Covid in October. Flu like symptoms seemed to pass by Monday. However, pulse remained elevated through the week by about ten points and noticed hypertension. BP 150/95 Wednesday and 160/100 on Friday. Went to ER Friday night with BP 188/117 and tachycardia. Vitals and blood work all normal however confusion as to why BP remains elevated despite Thursday before vaccine being 132/82. Left hospital with BP 154/95. Palpatations and thumping chest have continued throughout the week. As well as general fatigue and fog behind the eyes.

Close
I received my first dose of the pfizer vaccine at 11am at the safeway pharmacy. I had consumed several glasses of water in the morning before the event, a cup of yerba mate tea, and a piece of toast. I smoke, and had smoked one cigarette in the morning before my appointment. Just after receiving the vaccine I ate a few pieces of jerky and maybe 15 Jojo potatoes from the safeway deli. I was advised to wait 15 minutes before leaving. I set an alarm. I bought some food to eat (jojo potatoes and jerky) and waited to leave the site until 11:22am. I felt strange/weird, but this isn't an unusual feeling after receiving any kind of shot/vaccine for me. I was driving to work and I started to feel just a little bit strange after smoking another cigarette. I got a little nauseous but nothing too bad. Thirty seconds later I started to get dizzy, my ears rang, I felt my blood pressure drop, and I passed out on the interstate going freeway speeds. I woke up around a minute and half later according to my brother who was on the phone. I was treated for injuries at emergency room.

Immunization reaction to COVID Vaccination: Vasovagal response Pt had his first Pfizer Imm today and was sitting down for 15 mins observation and at 1142 pt stated that he is feeling dizzy. On observation pt was diaphoretic and feeling dizzy. He denied shortness of breath and chest pain or difficulty breathing. As I am talking to him he started to faint. Close
Within 2 minutes of vaccine i became very light headed and needed to lay down and was sweating. This is common with me with any vaccine. Within 24 hours severe shortness of breath and severe chest pains. Went to 2 urgent cares. Was prescribed Prednisone and a Inhaler. Both did nothing. Symptoms got worse. went to my primary doctor who ordered a chest X ray which came back good. and a EKG which came back with a slight issue and referred me to a cardiologist next month. Was sent home to recover. Pain and shortness of breath got worse. Within a week after that i got severe headaches and the left side of my head arm and leg began to get numb and tingle sensation which lasted about 48 hours. About 2 weeks after vaccine i began to improve. Chest pain started to go away and my shortness of breath as well. As of today 4-18-2021 no chest pain, and shortness of breath still comes and goes but nothing compared to weeks before.

33 2021-04-20 coughing up blood he feels like his throat is so raw; Second COVID-19 vaccine: sore arm; Second COVID-19 vaccine: feel... Read more
Close
he feels like his throat is so raw; Second COVID-19 vaccine: sore arm; Second COVID-19 vaccine: feeling achy/ Her husband is still sore/achy today; Second COVID-19 vaccine: nauseous; Second COVID-19 vaccine: vomiting/ throwing up; Second COVID-19 vaccine: diarrhea; Second COVID-19 vaccine: fatigue; vomiting blood; Second COVID-19 vaccine: blood in the phlegm or just whatever he spit up / spitting up blood; Second COVID-19 vaccine: Chilly; Second COVID-19 vaccine: redness around his eyes, like under his eyelids; his pores looked red; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (wife). A 33-year-old patient (husband) received the second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE) via an unspecified route of administration administered in right arm on 05Apr2021 15:40 (Lot Number: ER8734) at single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included atopic dermatitis. Concomitant medication included dupilumab (DUPIXENT), an injection that patient takes every other week to control his atopic dermatitis, he has been using this for 3 years at least. The patient previously received the first dose of BNT162B2 (Lot number: ER6207) in left shoulder on 15Mar2021 15:40, at the age of 32 years old, for COVID-19 immunization, and experienced arm sore and body aches. The patient experienced vomiting blood in Apr2021, blood in the phlegm or just whatever he spit up / spitting up blood in Apr2021, he feels like his throat is so raw on 05Apr2021, sore arm on 05Apr2021, feeling achy/ her husband is still sore/achy today on 05Apr2021, nauseous on 05Apr2021, vomiting/ throwing up on 05Apr2021, diarrhea on 05Apr2021, chilly in Apr2021, redness around his eyes, like under his eyelids; his pores looked red in Apr2021, fatigue on 05Apr2021. No treatment received for the adverse events. Outcome of the events pain in arm, ache, nauseous, erythema, fatigue was not recovered, of the other events was unknown. Clinical course as reported: Her husband got their second dose of the vaccine on 05Apr2021. Her husband was having a more severe reaction than the first time. The first time he got the vaccine his arm was sore. Last night (05Apr2021), the caller's husband was vomiting just over and over and had diarrhea, both at the same time. Wife added the thing she was worried about was that her husband was vomiting blood as well, and that her husband said it was from the phlegm, like he felt like his throat was so raw. Her husband did not really want to eat anything which she expected was normal. She was trying to give him fluids, and having him drink a little bit. Her husband had not vomited since around 4 am. And right now, he was sleeping. She did not know if she should give him medicine or take him to be seen or if this was a normal reaction to the vaccination. She did read side effects from the paper and she saw that some vomiting was expected but the blood was what caught her off guard. Around 10 o'clock last night (05Apr2021), her husband felt nauseous and went to bed. She actually fell asleep on the couch and heard her husband vomiting across the house, that was how bad the vomiting was. The vomiting started at midnight last night (05Apr2021). Her husband has been vomiting every couple of hours (2 hours), around the clock. Diarrhea had been at the same time. From her understanding, her husband had vomited at least 3 or 4 times, and had diarrhea 3 or 4 times. She kind of lost track after the 3rd time, but she had not heard him since around 4 am Her husband was still sore/achy today (06Apr2020) and was is still nauseous. She believed he was also feeling chilly. He was wrapped up in his blanket. Her husband did not have a fever, she has been checking his temperature. Wife stated no treatment yet, as she did not know what was safe. Her husband wanted to wait until he stopped vomiting because anything he put in his stomach came right back up. After the first time her husband was done throwing up, and was only dry heaving, he started to like kind of spit. When he would gargle or spit, there was blood in the phlegm or just whatever he spit up. The first time the wife went to check on him, she saw him spitting up blood. It was not like his vomit was red with blood in it, it was just the after effects, so she thought she should call and report this. Each time he has vomited, there was still that spit up of blood afterwards. The patient himself clarified the vomiting was last around 4 am (06Apr2020), give or take, and the last stool/bout of diarrhea was around 7 am (06Apr2020). He was still feeling nauseous and fatigued. He added that after the first time he vomited and the couple times he checked later on, he looked in the mirror and saw that there was this redness around his eyes, like under his eyelids. He adds it was red, it wasn't like splotchy, but it was like his pores looked red, like pinpoints. The patient clarified that the fatigue and achiness probably started around the first time he vomited, and that was still hanging around. The wife stated this was better than him getting Covid. Wife added what she was trying to see was if she should take her husband to the hospital or not. She did not want to wait too long, but if this was something that was a side effect that was expected, then her husband could just sleep it off.

INTERVIEW WITH PT WHO SAID HIS LEFT ARM STARTED TO CRAMP BEFORE THE SHOT WHEN HE WAS REMOVING HIS SHIRT. PT RECEIVED HIS PFIZER VACCINE AT 1205PM, THEN TO 15MIN WAITING. HE SAID HE FELT FLUSHED, AND SEEN SPOTS. ASSISTED BY EMERGENCY PERSONEL WITH VS TAKEN. EP SAID THE PT WAS DIAPHORETIC AND PALE WHEN HE MADE IT TO THE CAR AT 1215 AND CALLED THE AMBULANCE MONITORED EKG BY EP AND ASSESSED BY THE AMBULANCE PERSONEL. PT REFUSED TO GO TO THE ER, SAID WOULD GO TO HIS PRIMARY PHYSICIAN WITH HIS WIFE, WHO WAS PRESENT AND DRIVING THE CAR. LEFT WITHOUT ANY ACUTE SYMPTOMS AND SAID WAS FEELING BETTER.

33 2021-04-28 fainting The patient began feeling light-headed and diaphoretic immediately after vaccine administration. He ... Read more
Close
The patient began feeling light-headed and diaphoretic immediately after vaccine administration. He was taken by wheelchair to a medical exam table to recline, with feet elevated on pillows. He stated he had not had anything to eat that morning or the evening prior. He was offered juice, and would take sips if it was held to his mouth, however did not want to eat any crackers. He was not verbal, answering questions by shaking his head yes or now only. Unsure if he remained oriented. He was also noted to have a brief syncopal episode. He was noted to be shaky and anxious. He complained of lethargy and was unable to bear weight/walk. His vitals upon arriving at the exam table were: BP 110/64 HR 45 SpO2 97% It was determined by RN that he may be hypoglycemic. No glucometer was available. She stated he was not able to tell them if he was diabetic. She decided to administer 1mg glucagon subcutaneously. He also continued sipping on apple juice. His vitals were repeated five minutes later and at that time were: 110/82 HR 84 SpO2 96% Ten minutes after this: 122/80 HR 74 SpO2 95%. This was now 1045. He was complaining of his head spinning when he tried to sit up and remained shaky. He was unable to stand or walk independently. At this time it was recommended that he go to the emergency room or urgent care. He denied an ambulance, but stated his mother could come pick him up and take him to the emergency room. She was contacted, arrived at 1105. His last set of vitals remained within normal limits at 1106. He was taken by wheelchair to his mother's car.

33 2021-04-30 loss of consciousness, blood pressure decreased Passed out; Felt strange/weird; Nauseous; Dizzy; ears rang; Blood pressure drop; This is a spontaneo... Read more
Close
Passed out; Felt strange/weird; Nauseous; Dizzy; ears rang; Blood pressure drop; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer, reporting for himself. A 33-year-old male patient received the first dose of the bnt162b2 (BNT162B2; Lot Number: EN6208), via an unspecified route of administration in the left arm on 25Mar2021 at 11:00 at a single dose for covid-19 immunisation. The patient received the vaccination in the pharmacy. There was no medical history or concomitant medications. There were no other vaccines administered in the last four weeks. On 25Mar2021 at 23:30, the patient experienced passed out, felt strange/weird, nauseous, dizzy, ears rang, and blood pressure drop. The clinical course was as follows: the patient was advised to wait 15 minutes before leaving. He set an alarm. He bought some food to eat (potatoes and jerky) and waited to leave the site until 11:22. He felt strange/weird, but this was not an unusual feeling after receiving any kind of shot/vaccine for the patient. He was driving to work and started to get a little nauseous but nothing too bad. Thirty seconds later, he started to get dizzy, ears rang, felt blood pressure drop, and passed out going freeway speeds. He was treated in the emergency department and released the same day. There was no treatment given in response to the events. There was no covid prior to or post vaccination. The clinical outcome of the events was recovering. No follow-up attempts are needed. No further information is expected.

At around 2 AM the night after the vaccine (5/1), I woke up feeling extremely cold and aching all over. This lasted until around 3 AM on 5/2. I also had occasional slight headaches during the day on 5/1. After the fever symptoms went away, the were immediately replaced by: runny nose, sneezing, some coughing, a slight wheeze (only lasted from 3 AM to 4 AM), slight chest tightness, itchy mouth/tongue, and throat tightness. All of those lasted until around 11 AM on 5/2. Only a slight throat tightness remains now (noon on 5/2).

Close
Patient came into clinic today to receive first dose of COVID-19 Vaccine PFIZER. Pt denied any allergies to food or medications. Pt denied any reactions to previous vaccines. Pt denied anaphylaxis hx. Pt states no Vaccines in the last two weeks. Pt denies any COVID positive. Pt stated last fainting episode was two years ago with a blood draw and included lightheadedness, dizziness with Needle puncture. Pt stated these sx occur most with blood draws. Due to this pt was informed that wait time will be 30 minutes and we moved pt from room two to room eight to sit in adjustable chair. Pt father and pt son were present. Reaction: At 1343 pt. began to feel light headed and pt was given a bottle of water to sip which pt did. Pt began to close eyes and laid head back without responding after a few sips of water. Administered Sternal rub and pt was asked LOC question with no response just groaning. VS were taken. After VS were complete pt began to answer questions verbally (ie name of son, as well as how many children pt. has etc) and pt answered correctly, but pt. continued to have eyes closed, was pale, and diaphoretic. Dr. was informed and was made aware of Initial Set of vital signs which were within normal limits. Dr. requested that pt be laid flat. Pt was put in Supine position and was assessed by physician. Pt was responsive, but required further monitoring. Pt stayed for 30 min and Dr. requested orthostatic VS which were all within normal limits. Pt was released after Dr's final assessment. Patient stayed for 40 min total and Patient was awake an oriented x4, left with father and patient son with no further issues. Patient was advised for second COVID-19 Vaccine to notify nurse about incident so that proper measures can be taken for patient safety.

Close
Post vaccine, a few hours later he had symptoms of an upper respiratory infection. It evolved into a fairly intense headache for which he took some ibuprofen. He had chills and fevers and felt very poorly. At 7 AM on Saturday, April 24 he suffered excruciating substernal chest pain. It was a burning sensation and it was so severe he wanted to die to relieve the pain. The pain was only minimally positional and it was nonpleuritic. He drove himself to the nearest hospital and even drove through some red lights to get there more quickly. When he arrived he had ST elevation in the same leads with his early repolarization which was perhaps a millimeter or so higher than the EKG we did in February. He had both an elevation of his troponin levels which were 5.07, 6.06, 5.72 and 5.73. A CK was 195 with an MB of 41.2. He was taken to the cath lab emergently. no coronary disease.

33 2021-05-13 lightheadedness, pulse abnormal, hypotension Patient post-vaccination (Pfizer/0.3ml/1st dose administered @10:23a) appeared to be seizing in his ... Read more
Close
Patient post-vaccination (Pfizer/0.3ml/1st dose administered @10:23a) appeared to be seizing in his chair during observation @ 10:26a. I rushed to him, requesting aid from his colleagues to help lay him on the ground and elevate his feet. He was unresponsive and disoriented, with shallow breathing and weak pulse, so I activated EMS @ 10:26a. He appeared to seize again so I instructed two men to help roll him onto his side, at which time, an RN managing the vaccines, took over monitoring while I talked to 911. EMS was on scene @ 10:29a. RN reports he'd had a vagal response, most likely due to witnessed severe anxiety during IM injection (name /right deltoid @ 10:23a). RN gave him Gatorade and he quickly became AOx3. When EMS arrived, he was able to stand up, with assist, and be placed on the gurney. EMS monitored him for ~ 20min onsite, at which time he became hypotensive, resulting in transport to the nearest ER with O2 and IV management. Per HR representative for a business patient was discharged @ ~2p the same day, with diagnosis of severe dehydration and hypokalemia, his reaction most likely a vagal event. Unknown if medications were given outpatient.

Concomitant medication included minocycline hcl taken for an unspecified indication, start and stop date were not reported at 50mg. (patient received within 2 weeks of vaccination). Patient received first dose of bnt162b2 at the age of 33-years-old, administered in Arm Right on 06Apr2021 12:30 PM (Lot Number: EW0158) for covid-19 immunisation. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. In the middle of the night, patient woke up to use the bathroom. At some time, he lost consciousness, fell, and hit head on the bathroom floor. Patient regained consciousness around 3am. At the hospital, he was diagnosed with a concussion. 33 2021-05-21 pallor, loss of consciousness pale and lost consciousness; fell from seated position; hit head causing a two inch laceration behin... Read more

pale and lost consciousness; fell from seated position; hit head causing a two inch laceration behind ear; pale and lost consciousness; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable healthcare professional. A 33-year-old male patient received bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 MRNA VACCINE), intramuscular, administered in Arm Left on 08May2021 (Batch/Lot Number: ER8731) as 2nd dose, single for Covid-19 immunisation. Medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. Historical vaccine included first dose of BNT162B2 on 17Apr2021 (Batch/lot number: EW0162) for covid-19 immunisation. On 08May2021, the patient walked to observation area and sat down. After about five minutes, the patient became pale and lost consciousness. The patient fell from seated position onto concrete ground and hit head causing a two-inch laceration behind ear. Ambulance was called and evaluated patient. The patient refuse to sign with AMR. The outcome of the events was unknown. Follow-up attempts are completed. No further information is expected.; Sender's Comments: Based on the available information and known product profile, the causal relationship between the reported loss consciousness which subsequently led to a fall resulting in a two-inch laceration behind ear and the use of BNT162B2 cannot be fully excluded. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees, and Investigators, as appropriate and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees, and Investigators, as appropriate.

33 2021-05-28 loss of consciousness Patient said he had a history of fainting/passing out after stressful medical events. He received ... Read more
Close
Patient said he had a history of fainting/passing out after stressful medical events. He received 1st dose of Pfizer vaccine from my intern without incident. He proceed to the waiting room to wait the 30 minutes that was recommended. After about 5 min. passed, his girlfriend alerted us that he was feeling faint. I went to check on him and after talking with him for a few minutes, his head rolled back and he lost consciousness for approx 5-10 seconds. I went into the pharmacy to dial 911. When I got back to him, he was already back awake. Fire dept was dispatched and they checked his vitals and he signed a form to go AMA to the hospital.

A 33-year-old male patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE) via an unspecified route of administration on 11May2021 10:15 (at 33-year-old) (Lot Number: EW0182) as 2nd dose, single in arm right for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included anxiety, depression, and panic. No known allergies. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. The patient previously received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE) via an unspecified route of administration on 19Apr2021 15:30 (at 33-year-old) (Lot Number: EW0171) as 1st dose, single in arm right for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient didn't receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. Prior to vaccination, the patient wasn't diagnosed with COVID-19. After about 7-10 days after 2nd dose vaccination he became very dizzy and fatigued, and had extreme brain fog and light headedness. There where times where he felt he was going to pass out. He also had shortness of breath, tightness in throat and dry mouth. He also developed a very strong metal taste in his mouth that lasted for a few weeks. Sometimes he would also get strange sensations or weakness in his muscles with sweats or hot flashes. Some days he would wake up feeling like he was intoxicated like a drunk feeling. The feelings also came with extreme anexity and panic although the symptoms themselves could have caused that. The onset date of events was reported as 14May2021 02:30 am. No treatment received for events. Since the vaccination, the patient hasn't been tested for COVID-19. The outcome of the events was resolving.

Close
My reactions to the second shot started with a sore arm, night sweating for the first day of injection (5/9). In the morning of the two days after the shot, there are also some minor nose bleedings. The primary reason I'm reporting is because of the symptoms below: On 5/10, I suffered from fatigue that I had to sleep every other couple of hours. In the night the adverse event that resembled myocarditis occurred when I went to bed (around 10 PM). The symptoms included respiratory difficulties/shortness of breath and severe chest pain especially when lying on my back, and pains in the upper body mostly in both arms. As a result, I wasn't able to sleep until 4 AM when these symptoms started to reduce. However the fatigue and periodic shortness of breath persisted for a couple of more days. I recognized these symptoms are much like the ones I experienced once in 2018, although I was able to get a diagnosis of myocarditis after being tested with ECG and blood tests. During that event the trajectory of serverless and recovery was similar.

A 33-year-old male patient received second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE, Solution for injection, Lot Number: EW0178), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Left on 07Jun2021 15:15 (at age of 33 years old) as single dose for COVID-19 Immunization. Caller stated he had side effects to the Pfizer COVID 19 vaccine and went to the ER (emergency room). The patient said he had to go to the emergency room because of side effects he was having to the COVID 19 vaccine. He is asking who will pay for his medical expenses. He experienced fever, muscle pain, a stronger pain in his head, pain in his throat and also his heartbeat was accelerated too much, all on 13Jun2021. Second dose received on 07Jun2021 in the left arm. After the second dose, it was 4 days starting on the 13Jun2021 with flu like symptoms. On the 16Jun2021, he couldn't stand up anymore so he went to the emergency room. He couldn't stand up anymore so he had to go to the emergency room on 16Jun2021. He was discharged from the emergency room. The emergency room ran some tests and told him to take some Tylenol. He had a COVID 19 test and he is expecting a call with the results and the staff at the hospital took his temperature. He explained to the hospital staff that he was having the symptoms that are on the COVID 19 vaccine paperwork and that was the reason for his visit, since he had the two COVID 19 vaccines. He would like to point out that he asked the nurse when he was going to have the second dose, since the first vaccine he was still having side effects, he asked her if he was in danger to have the second vaccine. The nurse told him he was ok to get the second vaccine. The nurse told him he might have some muscle pain but he shouldn't be worried about it. At the emergency room he also had some blood tests. And also they took his pulse and after that the doctor was reading something in English that the interpreter couldn't catch and read. He provided Pfizer with what happened so far since he had the vaccine. He wasn't able to stand up with the muscle pain and he couldn't support his legs any longer, all on 16Jun2021. He would like to know if he's going to get some help with the medical bills. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included Blood test: negative, COVID-19 virus test: negative on 16Jun2021. The outcome of the events was unknown. information on the lot/batch number has been requested.

Close
Strong beating heart, irregular heartbeat; Palpitations and lightheadedness.; Palpitations and lightheadedness.; Body chills; Throbbing headache; Fatigue; Borderline left atrial enlargement; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer.A 33-years-old male patient received second dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE; Solution for injection; Batch/Lot number was not reported), via an unspecified route of administration on 10Jun2021 at 12:15 (33 years age at the vaccination) as dose 2, single for COVID-19 immunization. The patient's medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. The other medications patient received within 2 weeks of vaccination included Tylenol after the second shot. Patient had no known allergies. Prior to vaccination, the patient not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, the patient not been tested for COVID-19. It was reported that the patient was overall a healthy athlete. On 16Jun2021 at 08:00 AM, after second shot, after body chills, throbbing headache and fatigue passed (2-3 days), the patient started to have strong beating heart, irregular heartbeat, palpitations and lightheadedness. Patient went to urgent care on his 5th day of having this with a very irregular heartbeat, so they took him in right away. All tests clear but EKG/ECG shown borderline left atrial enlargement. Still watching and keeping record today. Adverse event resulted in Doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit, Emergency room/department or urgent care. No therapeutic measures were taken for the events. The patient recovered from body chills, throbbing headache and fatigue in Jun2021, and patient had not yet recovered from rest of the events. Information on the lot/batch number has been requested.

He experienced some unusual side effects that were not listed on the web. His boss advised him to call. Within a few minutes on 31Dec2020 after getting the vaccine he was feeling like he was going to pass out but didn't. His throat was really dry within 10-15 minutes on 31Dec2020. He was very shaky. He was not falling over but had to be careful with his steps. After getting the vaccine you have to sit and be monitored for 15 minutes. After that he was ok enough. He thought this was an expected reaction. He usually reacted to things though he didn't know why. He did fine with the flu shot. He had burning sensation like a really bad acid reflux in chest that went to his back on 31Dec2020. His throat was no different compared to like when you were going to get sick. He had drank a ton of water and his throat was still dry. He was not shaky but he felt off. It was hard to explain. Investigation assessment was no. The outcome of shaky and feeling like he was going to pass out was recovered on 31Dec2020, of dry throat was not recovered, of burning sensation was recovering, of others was unknown. Information on Lot/batch number has been requested.

34 2021-02-17 cardiac arrhythmia, chest pain Premature ventricular contractions; Postural Orthostatic tachycardia syndrome; Dizziness; shortness ... Read more
Close
Premature ventricular contractions; Postural Orthostatic tachycardia syndrome; Dizziness; shortness of breath; chest pain; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable physician (patient). A 34-years-old male patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 mRNA Vaccine, Lot number EL0140, in Hospital, via an unspecified route of administration in left arm, on 22Dec2020 (at 34 years of age) at single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included prediabetes (glucose tolerance impaired) from an unknown date. The patient didn't have COVID-19 prior to vaccination. Concomitant medication included metformin and multivitamins. On 09Jan2021 the patient experienced premature ventricular contractions, postural orthostatic tachycardia syndrome, dizziness, shortness of breath and chest pain. The events resulted in Emergency room/department or urgent care access and hospitalization as life threatening events. The patient was treated with diltiazem, fludrocortisone, aspirin and atorvastatin. He remained in hospital 2 days and then he was discharged. The patient underwent COVID-19 test (nasal swab) on 12Jan2021 and 13Jan2021 and both gave negative results. The patient had not recovered yet from the reported events at the time of the report.; Sender's Comments: The causal relationship between BNT162B2 and the events ventricular extrasystoles, postural orthostatic tachycardia syndrome, dizziness, dyspnea and chest pain cannot be excluded as the information available in this report is limited and does not allow a medically meaningful assessment. The patient is a young adult with known prediabetes, but no other comorbidities reported. Information on tests done during admission, clinical course and working diagnosis would be helpful in further assessment of this case. This case will be reassessed once additional information becomes available. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees, and Investigators, as appropriate.

Close
Patient received second dose of Pfizer vaccine at 5pm on 2/18/21 and experienced expected symptoms of fatigue, injection site pain and minor body aches. Patient began to experience difficulty breathing on the morning 2/20, at that time the patient attributed it to asthma. Patient reports that he has not had an acute asthmatic episode in 25 years and has not experienced any respiratory condion like this before. Shortness of breath, chest pain and dizziness increased in the day to follow. On Monday 2/22 at 8:30am patient was seen at family medical facility by Doctor presenting with a 02 SAT of 93%. Covid test was preformed and was negative. Dr prescribed a preventative inhaler and some prednisone and sent patient home. Patient continued to decompensate and at 6pm was seen by previously treating physician, presenting with 02 sat of 91% given a nebulizer and sent home. Patients condition worsened overnight and he was seen in the faility Urgent care at 9am on 2/23. Patient was given a repeat covid test, that was negative , flu test that was negative, and chest xrays that were clear.

34 2021-04-04 inflammation of the heart muscle, troponin increased, chest pain Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine EUA (administered on 03/26/21) Fever, chills, headache, general so... Read more
Close
Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine EUA (administered on 03/26/21) Fever, chills, headache, general soreness all began on 03/27/2021. On 03/28/2021, I began to notice chest pain and simultaneous pain in my left arm on 03/28/2021. The fever, chills, headache, and general soreness subsided on 03/29/2021, but the periodic chest and arm pain persisted and continued to get worse. On 03/29/2021 I also had nausea/vomiting and sweating. On the morning of 03/30/2021 during an episode of chest and arm pain we went to the Emergency Department at. At the emergency department, they detected elevated troponin levels indicating damage to the heart muscle. I was rushed via ambulance for an emergency heart catheterization. I was admitted to the hospital and monitored while various other tests were performed. It was determined that there was inflammation of the heart muscle (myocarditis).

34 2021-04-06 heart rate decreased The patient developed a sensation of seeing bright sparkly spots in his vision that lasted a brief m... Read more
Close
The patient developed a sensation of seeing bright sparkly spots in his vision that lasted a brief moment. He said that this typically happens after he gets a shot or is exposed to needles. He then asked if he could lay himself down because he says that is what usually helps him feel better. His SBP was measured to be in the 80s initially with a heart rate in the low 50s. His oxygen saturation was normal. He was given some water to drink. After a few minutes, his heart rate and blood pressure returned to normal. We discussed having him go to the hospital. After our evaluation, the patient preferred to go home. We asked that he go to the hospital if his symptoms returned.

34 2021-04-09 loss of consciousness He had flu-like symptoms after receiving the vaccine on Monday 3/29. He woke up on Tuesday 3/30 with... Read more
Close
He had flu-like symptoms after receiving the vaccine on Monday 3/29. He woke up on Tuesday 3/30 with fatigue and a low-grade fever. He was scheduled for a routine doctor's appointment late Tuesday afternoon. At the doctor's office he had a seizure, which caused him to lose consciousness for 15 seconds. Upon waking, he was transferred to the Hospital. He was released later that day. On Wednesday 3/31, he experienced a headache & went to the hospital. He was admitted and stayed in the hospital for 2 nights. An MRI found micro-bleeds on his brain. He was treated with lamotrigine and sent home with a prescription for 25mg/twice daily. He has a follow up appointment with a neurologist in 3 weeks.
34 2021-04-10 fainting April 7, woke up with a headache, took ibuprofen. A few hours later, started feeling hazy, lighthead... Read more
Close
April 7, woke up with a headache, took ibuprofen. A few hours later, started feeling hazy, lightheaded and had trouble concentrating while working from home. Felt like I was going to pass out. Took a break from computer screen, symptoms appeared to subside. An hour later, same haziness feeling came back. Thought I was going to pass out again. Called 911. ER diagnosed me with near syncope. Told me to keep an eye on symptoms and come back if things worsen. I informed them I had received one dose of vaccine, they didn?t seem to think it was related. Symptoms have slightly improved since, but still have bouts of dizziness four days later.

Patient had syncopal episode 3 minutes after receiving COVID-19 vaccine at local pharmacy. Per ED provider note, pt reported feeling lightheaded and then falling forward. Has felt lightheaded after giving blood in the past. He was transported by EMS to the ED. No nausea, vomiting, or vision changes. Head CT negative during work-up. Patient received his tetanus shot while in ED, along with stitches due to forehead laceration from his fall. No other treatment required.

Post vaccine pt experienced heart palpitations, sob and lightheadedness. Pt arrived to med obs at 1004 via wc. Upon arrival pt reports heart palpitations, extremities tingling. lips tingling and mild throat tightness. Vitals obtained and monitored. Pt denies pruritus, no wheezing noted upon auscultation. Symptoms resolved on their own. Per on site physician pt ok to be released. Pt released by self at 1020. 34 2021-04-15 nosebleed At approx. 5:00pm on 4/15/21 I started to get a nose bleed. Bled lasted approx. 5-8mins and was smal... Read more
Close
At approx. 5:00pm on 4/15/21 I started to get a nose bleed. Bled lasted approx. 5-8mins and was small to medium flow (napkin of two). Bleeding stopped for approx. 5 mins and started a second time. Second bleed lasted approx. 6-10mins and was a medium to heavy flow (4-5 napkins). When I was able to wash out the blood a large blood slime was pulled out from my nose. All bleeding was from the right nostril. No bleeding has occurred since (approx. 15hrs later).
34 2021-04-15 loss of consciousness, palpitations Within an hour of receiving the vaccine, I began to feel "odd" (i.e heart racing, spine tingling, st... Read more
Close
Within an hour of receiving the vaccine, I began to feel "odd" (i.e heart racing, spine tingling, strange sensations in my hands, and dizziness). At the hour mark, while trying to "walk it off" inside my backyard, things escalated quickly. As I came back inside, I suddenly collapsed and and lost consciousness. Luckily my best friend was with me and she described my behavior as a full on seizure (which I am not predisposed to). According to her, I was flopping around, spitting wildly and drooling all over my face, my eyes wide and glazed staring into nothing, lips turning blue. She immediately called 911 and within 5-10 minutes, two EMT's arrived and began to speak to me and take my vitals. For a good 15 minutes I couldn't sit up and had to lay on the ground, still extremely out of it - unable to think, merely in extreme discomfort similar to the most intense flu I've ever experienced. After a half hour or so, I sat up and was able to thank them for helping me and answer some of their questions. Over another 15 or so minutes they said all my vitals were perfect and they were not worried about me - sure I'd make a full recovery, which I hope I did. I am feeling MUCH better today. The reason I felt it so important to submit this report is because I had never heard of anyone experiencing side-effects that severe. Of course I had heard it could wipe you out, give you chills, aches, and exhaustion - but I had never heard that it could lead to a seizure so scary that my best friend thought I might be dying. I truly don't know what might have happened without her. People should know to have someone at home with them after the second dose. I am not over-exaggerating about my symptoms whatsoever. My body still hurts all over and I feel as if I went through some type of gauntlet yesterday. I absolutely do NOT want to discourage anyone from getting the vaccine, but I wish I had some notion that something so severe could happen to me.
34 2021-04-15 loss of consciousness Patient was shopping in the store after receiving the vaccine and passed out. Patient's spouse lower... Read more
Close
Patient was shopping in the store after receiving the vaccine and passed out. Patient's spouse lowered him to the ground. Upon arrival to the scene, patient was talking "saying i'm fine). I helped patient to sit up and eventually helped him to sit in a chair. Patient said he could taste the vaccine while receiving the shot and he told the immunizing technician about it. Patient left after 20 minutes without any treatment.

Close
At 1140, RRT was activated for a 34 y/o M that passed out for a few seconds. He stated, ?I felt like I was in a dream.? His eyes rolled back before passing out. When he was alert after his fainting episode, he stated that his right arm was numb and had c/o nausea, weakness, a brief moment of blurry vision, and ?feeling hot?. Head-to-toe assessment completed. Client was diaphoretic and pale. Client also reported that he was feeling hot and then feeling cold all of a sudden and this was ongoing. Client vaccinated on the R arm at 1130. NKA, no past medical hx. Does not take any medications but smoked marijuana just prior to his appointment. Vitals ? BP: 138/98, RR: 20, HR: 65, 0/0 pain. EMS called. Client?s condition improved during monitoring period but as EMS arrived, client began to feel same symptoms again but did not pass out. EMS arrived at 1149. Vitals when they arrived were: BP: 142/77, HR: 48. Client?s condition did not improve significantly but did not get worse. Client opted to have ambulance transport to Community ER to be further evaluated and treated. Client left vaccination clinic via Representative, accompanied by Fire Engine and unit @ 1200. Girlfriend, who came with client, followed client to hospital. Client left in stable condition, AA0x4, breathing even and unlabored, in no acute distress.

34 2021-04-22 hypertension I had a nasty zit on the back of my neck, popped it, and my immune response was extreme. Initial: It... Read more
Close
I had a nasty zit on the back of my neck, popped it, and my immune response was extreme. Initial: Itching and burning through my neck and shoulders, and swollen lymph nodes in neck and collarbone. I began sweating at night profusely and losing weight. I have had a lot of trouble sleeping. These symptoms continued in 24-48 hour cycles of flare ups until 04/19/2021 but finally seem to be abating. Progression: secondary symptoms appeared over the course of the month such as full body joint soreness, weakness, stiffness, stabbing pains (in the neck, arms, chest, and abdomen), blood pressure spikes, dry/sore throat, dry eyes, difficulty swallowing. Symptoms are similar to arthritis or other autoimmune diseases. Night sweats continue but are lighter. Weight loss continues but slower. Sleeping remains irregular.

34 2021-04-23 pallor, fainting, loss of consciousness At approximately 6:00pm on 04/23/2021 patient during 30 minute observation had a witnessed syncopal ... Read more
Close
At approximately 6:00pm on 04/23/2021 patient during 30 minute observation had a witnessed syncopal episode with loss of consciousness. Pt was assisted to stretcher during episode and assessed, presenting unresponsive initially, and then improved to AA&Ox4, airway patent, breathing normal and non-labored. Pulse bounding and thready with delayed perfusion. Pt skin pale, diaphoretic, and cool. Pt condition did not improve with oral hydration. EMS contacted via 911 for transport to the hospital. Pt administered 300ml IV Normal Saline via 18g catheter in left AC. Vitals as follows: (1800 91P, 112/58 16R, 98%)(1808 99P,90/50, 23R, 98%)(1812 109P, 94/50, 20R, 98%)

No CP / Neuro Sxs / breathing difficulties / skin changes. He was fasting for religious reason; also has h/o fainting when he tried to donate blood. SBP came up to 100 after about 10mins. He felt better after several bottles of water and a banana and was symptom free when he left the clinic about 30-40 minutes later.

34 2021-04-24 hypertension, heart rate increased, chest discomfort nausea; diarrhea; excessive sweating; chills; hot flashes; shortness of breath; chest tightness; ele... Read more
Close
nausea; diarrhea; excessive sweating; chills; hot flashes; shortness of breath; chest tightness; elevated liver enzymes; blood pressure and heart rate were high. BP was approx 180/120; heart rate were high; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 34-year-old male patient received bnt162b2 (BNT162B2), dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration in the left arm on 19Mar2021 08:15 (Batch/Lot Number: ER2613) as a single dose for covid-19 immunisation. Medical history included asthma, IBS (irritable bowel syndrome), and allergies to shellfish, fish and seafood. The patient was not diagnosed with Covid-19 prior to vaccination. Concomitant medications included glucosamine and cetirizine, all indication, start and stop date were not reported. The patient did not receive other vaccine in four weeks. The COVID 19 vaccine was received in a hospital. Approximately 12:15 AM on 21Mar2021, the patient began to experience chest tightness, shortness of breath, nausea, diarrhea, excessive sweating, chills and hot flashes. The patient took himself to the emergency room (ER) on 21Mar2021. The patient also mentioned that his temperature was normal, but his blood pressure (BP) and heart rate were high. BP was approximately 180/120 (unit unspecified). The ER ran Chest X-Ray, EKG, CBC, CMP, Protime-INR, Magnesium, Troponin, Partial Thromboplastin Time and TSH. The results were normal ranges besides high heart rate and elevated liver enzymes. The adverse events required doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit and emergency room/department or urgent care. The events received treatment for the adverse events which included albuterol-ipratropium, aspirin and IV fluids. The patient has not been covid tested post vaccination. The outcome of the events was recovering.

34 2021-04-28 loss of consciousness pass out; I started feeling dizzy little bit; really feel very fatigue; I start breathing hard/barel... Read more
Close
pass out; I started feeling dizzy little bit; really feel very fatigue; I start breathing hard/barely can breathe; start seeing everything turned yellow; soaking sweating; But couldn't move; sharp pain in my stomach; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 34-year-old male patient received first dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, solution for injection, lot/batch number and expiration date not reported), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Left arm on 15Apr2021 at 16:30 (at the age of 34-year-old) at single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history reported as no other medical history, no known allergies. Prior to vaccination, patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Concomitant medications reported as none. Patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. After 5 min from taking the shot on 15Apr2021 at 16:35, patient started feeling dizzy little bit. He thought walking around the aisle. But he still really felt very fatigue. He wanted back and a suit and started breathing hard. He started seeing everything turned yellow and barely could breathe. Then he passed out. The stuff came and help put an alcohol by his nose. He was soaking sweating. But couldn't move. The ambulance came to check his heart, blood sugar and blood oxygen on 15Apr2021, all with unknown results. Then patient started having sharp pain in his stomach. He had lunch on 15Apr2021 at one but he had spinach broccoli and beans. Patient was healthy. He worked out four times a week. After 30 minutes of receiving care. Patient felt better but he was worry for tonight on 15Apr2021. Events resulted in Doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit. Since the vaccination, patient had not been tested for COVID-19. Therapeutic measures were taken as result of event passed out included put an alcohol by his nose, treatment for the other events was unknown. The outcome of the events was unknown. Information on the lot/batch number has been requested.

34 2021-05-01 pallor, lightheadedness Patient received his vaccine and a few minutes later felt like he was going to pass out. He said his... Read more
Close
Patient received his vaccine and a few minutes later felt like he was going to pass out. He said his head felt foggy and just didn't fell well. He was brought back to med observation 1 by wheelchair. He looked pale and felt clammy. We laid him down on the stretcher and almost immediately felt better. He had a water when he came to us and he was given some crackers to eat. His color returned to normal and skin felt warmer. He stated that he was ready to leave. His wife was out in the car waiting for him. We took vitals at 10:12 am - heart rate 79, o2 98, BP 115/83, at 10:16 am heart rate 80, o2 99, BP 125/79, at 10:20 am heart rate 80, o2 99, BP 127/76. We released patients with other at 10:21am.

Close
6 hours from vaccine === Mild injection arm pain 12 hours == Severe injection arm pain (can?t raise beyond chest level) Chills 16 hours == High heart rate (160 bpm) 18 hours == 103 fever Severe headache Unable to sleep Exhaustion ** Took 1000 mg of Tylenol at 21 hours 24 hours == Heart rate is now only slightly elevated (120 bpm). ** Took 1000 mg of Tylenol at 25 hours 30 hours == Vomiting (x2) Heart rate is now normal 48 hours == Joint pain (shoulders and neck) Nausea subsides Temperature drops below 100 Headache is now mild 72 hours == Back to normal

Close
Originally I had bodyaches, chills, headaches, and shortness of breath. Some of those cleared up rather quickly, but then either I developed new symptoms: loss of smell and taste, difficulty swallowing, difficulty breathing especially while laying down, sharp pain when sneezing or hiccuping in my midsection, tightness in chest.

Close
34 y/o male with no known medical history, who presents with seizure like activity lasting 2-3 seconds post vaccination. Patient states that this is his second vaccination in the two-dose series. Patient denies previous reaction with the first vaccination. Patient states that he fears needles. Patient was witnessed with upper arm stiffening, convulsions and syncope lasting 2-3 seconds. RNs lowered patient to the ground with legs elevated. Patient regained consciousness within seconds. Patient was not post ictal. Patient denies headache, sore throat, difficulty breathing or itch. Patient vitals (151/79 BP, 98% O2, 74 HR, 14 Resp, Glucose 125, EKG NSR). Fire rescue was called. Patient was placed in wheelchair and taken to private area where he was further assessed by the Paramedics, NP and RN. Patient was noted to be diaphoretic. Water provided and patient placed in Trendelenburg position. Fire rescue arrived. Patient refused to be transported to the ER, although it was advised by the NP. Fire rescue did not have the patient sign out AMA. AMA form provided and signed, witnessed by the NP. Patient aware of risk involved with no seeking further medical evaluation, such as worsening adverse reaction, subsequent seizures, cardiac event, MVA and/or death. Patient verbalized understanding. Patient ambulated to his car without difficulty.

34 2021-05-24 loss of consciousness, low blood pressure, fainting As a clinical monitor, I was called over to assess a driver slumped over in his seat. He had just re... Read more
Close
As a clinical monitor, I was called over to assess a driver slumped over in his seat. He had just received the second dose of the Pfizer vaccine approximately 10 minutes earlier. The passenger (his fiance) said he was acting normal until she heard him grunt and then realized that he was passed out. While attempting to lay flat, I performed a jaw thrust that yielded a stridulous inspiration but was still unresponsive. He did not have a palpable carotid pulse. Paramedics was summoned emergently. Within 30-45 seconds, he awoke but was confused and amnestic to the event. He had no physical complaints and no significant medical or allergy history. I auscultated his larynx (no stridor) and his lungs (CTA). His initial vitals: BP 90/51 HR 61 VR 16 SaO2 100% An electrocardiogram demonstrated a sinus rhythm without ischemic changes or evidence of conduction delay. His glucose was 119. Over the next 30 minutes, he was able to drink two bottles of water and some orange juice. That said, he still said he "felt off." Repeat vital signs: BP 118/62 HR 69 SaO2 100%. The medics advised him to follow up with his doctor, preferably today. His fiance agreed to drive him to an ED near their home for a more thorough evaluation. I provided her my phone number to provide to the ED for any questions. His clinical syndrome was consistent with a syncopal episode associated with orthostatic hypotension. Low suspicion for anaphylaxis.

Close
I was getting ready for bed (around 2am, early night for me) and suddenly felt dizzy, nauseous, and incredibly hot. I was very stressed about it and it had been six days since the shot, so I just assumed I was either having a heart attack or a really bad panic attack. I did a meditation and chewed a couple aspirin just in case. There was extreme tightness in my chest. Breathing was difficult. The dizziness, nausea, and inability to control my body temperature went away within a couple hours and I managed to sleep. But the chest tightness and difficulty breathing persisted for about 3 or 4 days. I also noticed it hurt more whenever I was sitting upright or forward, and it hurt almost zero when I leaned back or laid down.

34 2021-06-01 heart rate increased 16 hours after my second shot, I woke up with some nausea. I went to the bathroom, did not vomit, h... Read more
Close
16 hours after my second shot, I woke up with some nausea. I went to the bathroom, did not vomit, however in the middle of urinating I collapsed on the floor, couldn't walk, couldn't form full sentences, started sweating profusely, had to crawl back to my bed, and my pulse was through the roof. I almost went to the ER, but the episode subsided within 15 minutes. When I tried to fall back asleep, it felt like I was blacking out and not drifting asleep. The next day, I experienced the typical flu like symptoms. Followed by 4 days of normalcy. On the 4th day, while working, I experienced a sharp 3 second "electric shock" feeling in my left side of my chest. On the 5th day, I already had previously scheduled an appointment with my primary for a physical. I told her about my episode; she took an EKG which yielded normal results. Lab work also looked ok. On the 6th day, I started feeling some more nausea and fatigue. On the 7th day, the vertigo intensified tenfold, and the room was spinning. That's when I started experiencing the following symptoms: ? More nausea. ? Dizzy spells that come and go, especially after eating. ? Persistent periodic electric shock feeling in my left chest. It?s dull but annoying. And just when I think it?s gone for good, another 1 second shock happens. ? Left arm is weak - the entire arm. ? When I try to sleep, the left side of my head feels as though I?m blacking out when I start drifting. It almost feels like I?m getting anesthesia or something like that. But just the left side. ? Basically the left side of my body (I got the jab in my left arm) from the waist up just feels off. ? One of my arms is numb when I wake up until I shake it out. It?s not one particular arm. ? Energy levels are low. Especially when I wake up and start moving around. On the 8th day, I went to the ER thinking perhaps it was a heart attack. Nothing - EKG was again normal and lab work was normal. The doctor told me it's all in my head - anxiety. However, I'm not anxious and I'm a very level headed individual. It's now day 12 and I feel overall awful. I can't concentrate on anything. I'm not thinking clearly and forgetting simple things. The dull feeling and electric shocks on my left side continue. I've never felt this bad before. I'm a healthy 34 year old that exercises regularly, has never smoked or done drugs, rarely drinks alcohol, and eats generally very healthy. If given a second chance I would not take the covid shot. I am praying this goes away.

Close
swelling and tenderness in lower right leg / vasculitis; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 34-year-old male patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Solution for injection; Batch/Lot number and Expiration date were not reported), via an unspecified route of administration (administered on the right arm) on 03Apr2021 10:15 (at the age of 34-years-old) as 1st dose, single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient's medical history was not reported. Concomitant medications included alprazolam (XANAX) and propranolol both taken for an unspecified indication, start and stop date were not reported. The patient previously took PERCOCET and experienced mild allergy. The patient didn't receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to COVID vaccine. Prior to vaccination, the patient has not been diagnosed with COVID-19. The patient experienced swelling and tenderness in lower right leg / vasculitis on 06Apr2021 15:00. It was reported that 3 days after vaccination the patient experienced swelling and tenderness in lower right leg and was initially misdiagnosed as infection. After symptoms persisted for 1.5 weeks and antibiotics had no effect, it was diagnosed as vasculitis. No rheumatological issues in blood test or blood clot. PCP determined likely an immune response to the vaccine. The adverse event resulted in emergency room/department or urgent care and doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit. Therapeutic measures were taken as a result of the event included antibiotics and antiinflamttories. Since the vaccination the patient has not been tested for COVID-19. The outcome of the event was recovering.

34 2021-06-07 pallor, loss of consciousness, lightheadedness convulsions; he was not conscious/Blacked out/pass out; Tunnel vision; shaking; sweating profusely; ... Read more
Close
convulsions; he was not conscious/Blacked out/pass out; Tunnel vision; shaking; sweating profusely; Lightheadedness/Dizziness; sore arm; He turned ghostly white; tired; weak; feeling like he was going to black out/going to pass out; could not elevate his feet; couldn't get comfortable; restless; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 34-years-old male patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 MRNA VACCINE), intramuscular in Arm Left on 17May2021 (at the age of 34-years-old) (Lot Number: EW0187) as single dose for covid-19 immunization. Medical history included higher than normal blood pressure, about 2-3 weeks ago, his blood pressure was very high due to really crazy stress in his life and eating terrible; headaches, smoked marijuana, drunk vodka, sometimes he had a sensitivity to needles, sometimes he will have angst or nervousness with needles, Sometimes he got a little queasy with the sight of needles and just had a ton of dental work done. Concomitant medications included cetirizine hydrochloride (Generic Brand Zyrtec); caffeine, paracetamol (EXCEDRIN) taken for headaches. He explained he took Generic Brand Zyrtec which he had been on for years now and he took Excedrin for headaches when he got them. Those were basically the only medications he took really. He hadn't had any type of vaccine. He previously had a tetanus shot about 10 years ago for Immunization. There was no previous immunization with the Pfizer vaccine considered as suspect. There were no additional vaccines administered on same date of the Pfizer suspect. There were no vaccinations within four weeks prior to the first administration date of the suspect vaccine. The patient received his first dose of the Pfizer BioNTech COVID 19 Vaccine on Monday, 17May2021. Within 3-5 minutes of getting the vaccine, he had a really crazy reaction. He remembered looking at his wife and she told him he was having mild convulsions as he was sitting in the chair in May2021. He was kind of shaking in May2021. He turned ghostly white and he began sweating profusely in May2021. He mentioned that her wife said that he was not conscious for around 5 minutes and was "snoring with eyes open" in May2021. He added that he was "fighting to stay awake" for around 15-20 minutes after that. He blacked out. All he remembers was that he was trying to fight off tunnel vision for a very brief time in May2021. The pharmacist continuously checked on him. The lightheadedness and feeling like he was going to black out lasted 15-20 minutes in May2021. They put him in a chair and told him to elevate his feet, but the caller explains he could not elevate his feet. He had his feet in another chair in front of him. He couldn't get comfortable, he was sitting down. He was restless, lightheaded. He kept feeling like he was going to pass out. So, then he tried to stand up and walk a little bit. He only made it 5 steps. So, he sat on the ground and laid down. He laid on the ground, flat on his back, and put his feet in a chair, which was about 2.5 feet above him for about 15-20 minutes. He started to feel better. He still felt very tired and weak in May2021 but he was able to stand up and walk and go home. He hadn't had a reaction since. He had had no other symptoms besides just a sore arm in May2021. He confirmed he recovered completely from his experience when he was administered the vaccine. He came home from the vaccine facility, laid on the couch and watched TV for a couple of hours and then fell asleep for 3-4 hours. He was tired, but he felt completely fine. He had no lightheadedness, no dizziness. He also wanted to add sometimes he has a sensitivity to needles, but he didn't when he received the COVID vaccine. Sometimes he will have angst or nervousness with needles, but he was actually excited to get the COVID shot. He was even comforting his wife and was telling her everything is going to be okay. He wasn't worried about the needle with the COVID shot. Sometimes, he gets a little queasy with the sight of needles, but he saw the needle and he didn't feel faint or angst when getting the shot. He just had a ton of dental work done, where he had huge needles shoved in his mouth and he didn't feel faint or anything. He really wanted to get the second shot to finish the vaccination series. He did kind of believe he had a reaction, he was not trying to play it off and say "oh I got the vaccine and passed out". He knew himself and knew what it's like to faint and this experience just felt different. He believed he had a reaction. He never felt tunnel vision that strong in his entire life, it felt like being punched in the face. Since those 2-3 weeks, his stress load had gone down and he had had a drastic change in his diet, so his blood pressure was reading much better now. This past Monday, 17May2021, when he received his vaccine, his blood pressure shouldn't have been that high. The EMT's did come before he left and because he passed out his blood pressure was low at 100/60. When providing the Lot number off of his vaccine record card, the patient explained the last digit was either a 7 or a 2, he can't read this person's handwriting", however, he eventually confirmed the number was a 7. The events did not require a visit to Emergency Room and Physician Office. The outcome of event tired was unknown and the outcome of the other events was recovered in May2021.

34 2021-06-17 pallor, lightheadedness anaphylactic reaction; about to black out/lost consciousness; cold sweats; had a hard time /trouble ... Read more
Close
anaphylactic reaction; about to black out/lost consciousness; cold sweats; had a hard time /trouble swallowing; turning pale; his pupils were dilated; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable Pharmacist via Medical Information. This Pharmacist reported for two patients, this is the first of two reports regards to a male patient. A 34-year-old male patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), via intramuscular, administered in left arm on 02Jun2021 between 10:00 and 11:00 am, maybe around 10:30ish (Batch/Lot Number: EW0178; Expiration Date: Aug2021, NDC number: 59267100002) as 1ST DOSE 0.3ML, SINGLE for covid-19 immunisation at pharmacy. The patient medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. No prior vaccinations (within 4 weeks). No additional vaccines administered on same date of the Pfizer suspect. A pharmacist from pharmacy had 2 patients who received the vaccine and both had a reaction after the dose, within one hour after receiving the dose, and EMS was called. The pharmacist confirmed the first patient had the reaction within 1 hour of receiving the dose. She clarified this person was having cold sweats, about to black out, had a hard time and trouble swallowing and was turning pale, his pupils were dilated. Pharmacist explained they make them sit there for 15 minutes after receiving the vaccine so this reaction happened maybe 3 minutes after he got the shot. The EMS came and he was brought to the hospital. The patient did come back afterwards and he said the doctor didn't know 100 percent what happened, but it might been a slight allergic reaction, not to the point where he lost consciousness, but they did release him. She clarified they checked his vitals and everything and released him. When pharmacist was probed for the event, the pharmacist thought it was an anaphylactic reaction. The events require a visit to Emergency Room, patient was brought by EMS. Not had a visit to Physician Office. Unknown if patient received treatment, the pharmacist wasn't be told that much information. The outcome of events was unknown. Causality: In this case, pharmacist did not think so. She thinks maybe it was anxiety but she wouldn't know.; Sender's Comments: Based on plausible temporal relationship, a possible causal association between the events and the suspect drug BNT162B2 cannot be excluded. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to regulatory authorities, Ethics Committees, and Investigators, as appropriate.,Linked Report(s) : US-PFIZER INC-2021646208 same reporter, product, different patient and similar events.

Close
Experienced shortness of breath and sharp pain around heart area the night after receiving dose. Was bedridden the following day. I had to travel back on Saturday so I was trying to rest and get better. Pain subsided a little, but the pain started back up again the weekend before Memorial Day holiday. This time the pain was the worst. The pain was a sharp pain around my heart area. My left SCN muscle was also inflamed. I was bedridden the entire weekend. In bed, when I turned left or right when lying down I would feel pain. I was not able to lift my head up to adjust my pillow without feeling sharp pain. I took Ibuprofen at 800 mg every 6 hours based on doctor recommendation. This pain lasted about 3 weeks with it gradually subsiding and now I am feeling better. However, I still feel a little something going on in the region around my heart.

I suffered from acute Idiopathic thrombocytopenic purpura; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 34-year-old male patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, solution for injection), dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Left on 18May2021 10:00 (Batch/Lot Number: EW0177) (at age of 34 years) as DOSE 1, SINGLE for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient medical history was none. Known allergies was none. Prior to vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. Other concomitant medications the patient received within 2 weeks of vaccination included vitamin C gummies. The patient suffered from acute idiopathic thrombocytopenic purpura on 18May2021 19:00. At the end of the 18th, patient noticed spots on arms and legs, about the size of the average mole. Later, gums bled and patient had blood blisters in mouth, from 1 to 3 after rinsing with listerine. The next day, he noticed more spots on feet and lower legs, similar to freckles. By the end of the day, his gums were bleeding unprovoked and he had hematuria. The bleeding continued and he went to the ER the following day and was informed that his platelet count dropped to 0. The adverse events resulted in doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit and emergency room/department or urgent care. Number of days of hospitalization was 3 days. Treatment received for the adverse events included Intravenous Immunoglobulin and steroids. Since the vaccination, the patient has not been tested for COVID-19. The outcome of events was recovering. Information on Lot/Batch number is available; Further information has been requested.

34 2021-06-30 palpitations, fast heart rate, chest pain, heart rate increased, chest discomfort 2 days after 2nd COVID vaccine (Pfizer), started to notice random onset heart palpitations and tachy... Read more
Close
2 days after 2nd COVID vaccine (Pfizer), started to notice random onset heart palpitations and tachycardia, as well as random minor chest pains, and occasionally moderate chest pains. chest pains could be described as a sharp pain or tightness that only lasts a second or two then typically goes away. It is now 6 months later and I am still experiencing heart issues: palpitations, elevated heart rate, fatigue, feeling "winded" when climbing stairs. Elevated heart rate is sometimes as high as 160bpm, even when sitting on the couch relaxing. Marijuana use will occasionally raise heart rate, but not consistently enough to be the cause of tachycardia. When heart rate is elevated, I will sometimes experience anxiety, which can lead to slight "difficulties" breathing (this seems to be caused by the anxiety, and when I notice my heart rate is high, I get nervous and think too much about it and probably focus too much on breathing normally) These symptoms and issues were not present prior to receiving my 2 COVID vaccines
34 2021-06-30 fainting, loss of consciousness After the administration of the vaccine, while waiting for the observation time, I lost consciousnes... Read more
Close
After the administration of the vaccine, while waiting for the observation time, I lost consciousness for more than two minutes, I completely fainted and all my muscles contracted until they were rigid. From the symptoms the doctor said it was a tonic-clonic seizure, and that it was a side effect of the vaccine. They told me I turned purple, stopped breathing, and exhaled the remaining air until I stopped breathing for about 30 seconds until then I came back to my senses. The firefighters examined me and all my vital signs were fine so they recommended that I go home and rest.

This physician reported similar events for 2 patients. This is 1st of 2 reports. A 35-year-old male patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), via an unspecified route of administration on 18Dec2020 at single dose for covid-19 immunization. There were no medical history and concomitant medications. Caller stated that his close friend who was ER physician (front line worker) and within 24 hours after receiving the COVID vaccine, developed COVID or symptoms of COVID. Patient received the COVID vaccine on 18Dec2020 and the same night patient started with a low grade fever, body aches, chills, muscle pain, shortness of breath, cough, O2 saturation of 80% (hypoxia) and was in the intensive care unit now. Patient swore this was related to the vaccine. This patient tested positive for COVID. He had a CT (computerised tomogram) scan which showed extensive infiltration in the lungs in Dec2020. Patient was admitted to the hospital on 24Dec2020 and then was moved to the ICU 2 days later, on 26Dec2020. Caller thought patient had a positive COVID test at another hospital. Caller did know that tested positive at the current hospital on 26Dec2020 which was done to confirm the previous positive test. Caller thought patient had his first positive COVID test either the same day or the next day after receiving the vaccine. Event of O2 Saturation of 80% / hypoxia was reported as hospitalization from 24Dec2020 and life threatening; infiltration in the lungs and shortness of breath caused hospitalization from 24Dec2020, muscle pain, chills and positive COVID test was reported as medically significant; and other events were reported as non-serious. Outcome of O2 saturation of 80% / hypoxia and shortness of breath was not recovered, outcome of cough was recovering; and outcome of other events were unknown. Information about lot/batch number has been requested. ; Sender's Comments: Based on the information currently available, a lack of efficacy with suspected vaccine BNT162B2 in this patient cannot be completely excluded.,Linked Report(s) : US-PFIZER INC-2020519020 same reporter/drug , different patient/AE.

Close
tachycardia with mild exertion; Baseline HR elevated; dyspnea; palpitation; chest tightness; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable physician (patient). A 35-years-old male patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE) (lot: EJ1685) via an unspecified route of administration in left arm on 29Dec2020 15:30 at single dose for COVID-19 immunization. There was no medical history, no known allergies, no allergies to medications, food, or other products. There were no concomitant medications. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine, no any other medications the patient received within 2 weeks of vaccination. On 29Dec2020, 3 minutes following vaccine injection - dyspnea, palpitation and chest tightness; lasted 3-4 minutes. 24 hours later (30Dec2020) - dyspnea and tachycardia with mild exertion (1 flight of stairs). Baseline HR elevated. No treatment was received for the adverse events. Events outcome was recovering.

Patient returned to baseline oriented with stable vital signs following event. Patient left clinic in stable condition after monitoring by RN for approximately 1 hour.
